Remembering the very American ideal that labor rights are human rights
Congressmen Keith Ellison and John Lewis proposed a bill that would protect trade unions as a civil right.
"There are trade unions, there are middle-class jobs," said Ellison, a Democrat from Minnesota who is the Co-Chairman of the Progressive Fraction Congress.
That is why I am proud to present the Employee Enlargement Act together with John Lewis, the symbol of the civil rights movement.

This innovative bill will give workers the same legal opportunities in the case of discrimination against trade unions as in other forms of discrimination, stopping the forces of opponents of trade unions

Amendment of the Labour Relations Law in such a way as to allow workers facing discrimination for their participation in trade union organizations to seek justice in civil courts - and to receive compensation for damages and fines - is a sensible and necessary initiative.
But it is certainly not a radical initiative – at least by American standards.
In fact, the best way to understand what Ellison, Lewis, and the co-authors of the bill are proposing is to remember a very American idea.

Despite the attacks on trade unions in recent years – in Wisconsin, Michigan, and other states across the country – Americans once supported countries around the world in adopting, expanding, and respecting labor rights.
There was a time that millions of Americans still remember when this country simultaneously defended democracy, freedom of speech, freedom of the press, and the right to organize.

When the United States occupied Japan after World War II, General Douglas MacArthur and his assistants helped the country adopt a constitution designed to ensure that the military dictatorship of Hideyoshi Tojo was replaced by democracy.

Fully aware that workers and their trade unions played a role in shaping the new Japan, they included a text that explicitly recognized that "the right of workers to organize, to negotiate, and to collective action is guaranteed."

When the United States occupied Germany after World War II, General Dwight David Eisenhower and his assistants helped the Germans write a constitution that guaranteed that Adolf Hitler's fascism was replaced by a strong democracy.

Recognizing that workers will need to be organized and heard in the new state, the Germans included an article which openly stated: "The right to form associations with the aim of protecting and improving labour and economic conditions will be guaranteed to every person and every profession or sphere of activity.
Agreements that restrict or seek to infringe this right will not have legal force; measures aimed at these purposes will be deemed illegal.

When former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt was Chairman of the International Commission on Human Rights, which drafted the Universal Declaration on Human Rights, to be adopted by the United Nations in 1948 as a global agreement, Roosevelt and the composers included a guarantee that "everybody has the right to organize and join trade unions to defend their interests."
Generations of Americans have accepted as the right basic position that labor rights are human rights.

When this country advised other countries on how to create civil and democratic societies, the Americans explained that the right to organize trade unions – and to have this trade union participate as an equal partner in collective bargaining with corporations and government institutions – must be protected.

Now that these rights are being attacked in America, it is wise, indeed, to return to the American ideal that working people should have the right to organize and that their voices should be heard in a free and open society.
As Reverend Martin Luther King the Younger said fifty years ago:
History is a great teacher.
Now everyone knows that the trade union movement did not undermine the power of the nation, but increased it.
By raising the living standards of millions, the trade unions miraculously created a market for industry and raised the entire nation to an unimaginable level of production.
Those who attack the trade unions forget these simple truths, but history remembers them.
History remembers as we should.
Official recognition of labour rights as human rights – and the extension of civil rights protection to prevent discrimination against trade unions – is long overdue.
Keith Ellison and John Lewis are reviving ideals that have historically expanded America and made the promise of democracy a reality.
A judge temporarily blocks a law that could close all abortion clinics in Louisiana

In the United States, a federal judge on Sunday temporarily blocked the implementation of Louisiana law, about which his supporters say he would most likely close all five abortion clinics in the state.

Under this measure, which was signed to be implemented by Louisiana Governor Bobby Jindal in June and was due to enter into force on September 1, doctors who perform abortions would be required to have authority to admit patients to a hospital within 30 miles of their practice.
However, the judge’s ruling means that doctors can continue to carry out legal abortions at the moment by continuing to seek such authority.
"Others will be allowed to work legally, continuing to act to obtain powers," wrote Judge John deGravels in his decision.
The hearing will be scheduled during the month in which the judge will make a more permanent decision on this law.
Advocates of abortion rights welcomed this decision, the latest in a series of decisions against similar measures, saying it would give doctors more time to obtain hospital powers.

"Today's decision guarantees that Louisiana women will be protected from a corrupt law that seeks to deprive them of their health and rights," said Nancy Norton, president and head of the Center for Reproductive Rights, which filed a lawsuit against three out of five state clinics.
It was not immediately clear whether the decision applies to doctors from two clinics, who did not act as complainants in this case, and also filed an application for authorization of admission.
Louisiana is among 11 states that have passed such laws, and courts have recently declared such measures unconstitutional in Alabama and Mississippi.
Key pieces of Texas law that would shut down most of the remaining clinics in the state were blocked by a federal judge on Friday.

Fighters for the right to abortion, together with the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists and the American Medical Association, say that the acceptance laws impose restrictions on doctors that are not necessary from the point of view of medicine.
Opponents of abortion object that such measures are aimed at protecting women's health, although some have also noted their positive effect in closing clinics.
Only one doctor who performs abortions in Louisiana has the authority to admit him to a hospital, the Center for Reproductive Rights reported.
If all other doctors in the state would be forced to stop performing this procedure, this doctor, fearing for his safety, would stop performing this procedure, the group said.
Criticizing the decision, Louisiana officials said they would not punish abortion doctors while their applications for acceptance are pending a decision.
What will lead to the introduction of quotas for domestic products
At least half of products for each kind of goods in the assortment of trading networks should be Russian production, deputy of the State Duma from the faction "Just Russia" Oleg Nilov believes.
The parliamentarian has prepared a bill aimed at introducing protective measures against domestic producers, the newspaper "Izvestiya" writes.
The document will be further elaborated to avoid possible discomfort for buyers.

This applies to goods that are not produced in Russia. <...> For the other groups of products that are produced in Russia, the retailer will have to provide at least half of its sites to domestic producers," Nilov told the publication.

Together with the amendments to the article "On the basis of the state regulation of trade activity in the Russian Federation" the bill provides for amendments to the Tax Code, establishing a reduced VAT rate of 10% on the sale of products produced in Russia.
The idea of introducing a 50% quota in trade networks is part of a package of incentive measures for Russian producers.
There will be several times more domestic goods on the shelves.
However, the initiative can have both a positive and a negative effect, experts say.

According to lawyer of the company "Nalovik", member of the independent expert center "Public Duma" Sergey Litvinenko, for the Russian economy, as well as for the domestic agricultural and food industries, the effect will be positive and will lead to growth.
Farmers, farmers and small shops will benefit.
They will be able to sell more, which means that profits will increase.
In addition, they will have the right to dictate to retailers their terms and prices, because they will be forced to buy their goods.
Russian producers will be able to increase the volume of their activities and sales, which will lead to higher taxes than before.
This will increase budget revenues, create new jobs, some industries will expand, some will learn faster, and contribute to GDP growth.
Russia’s dependence on foreign food will decrease several times, but not immediately,” the expert notes.
Earlier, Russian companies were often unable to penetrate the entrances of local shops due to high competition from foreign counterparts.
Now, after the introduction of the embargo, this niche has been liberated and you can breathe comfortably.
But it should not be forgotten that after all necessary agreements and sanitary inspections, food products from Latin America, Turkey and Serbia will enter the Russian market.
In other words, now there is a "moment of silence" when the former players have already left and the new ones have not yet come.

Almost a month later, it is possible to talk about the increased demand for domestic raw materials, as well as the rise in prices for finished products", - said AIF.ru the first Vice-President of the general Russian public organization "Russian Club of Financial Directors", k.e.n. Tamara Kasyanova.
Clearly, the idea of selling at least 50% of Russian food products in each category will enable the sector to catch up with local producers.
In this case, they will compete with each other, not with goods that are cheaper at the expense of subsidies from another state.
In other words, the struggle for the buyer will spread between companies operating under the common laws of the industry.
On the other hand, Kasyanova notes, Russian producers are able to meet 50% of domestic needs of citizens by far not all articles.
And in this situation, trade networks will have to "delay" the share of Russian goods to half the assortment.
As a result, there are growing fears that poor quality goods will arrive at the entrances.
It is possible that foreign products with overwritten labels will be supplied in the form of products produced in Russia," the expert adds.
The negative effect of introducing quotas will be felt by large trading networks, especially those that prefer to cooperate with importers.
It is logical that foreign suppliers will also benefit from such a deployment, as demand for their products will decrease.
Litvinenko does not rule out that the law on quotas for domestic goods can also affect consumers.
The fact is that some products of Russian production may be inferior in quality to imported analogues, while shops will be able to price the second as a scarce commodity.
The idea of import substitution, which was forgotten in the early 2000s, was revived by economists in February of this year due to the continuous devaluation of the ruble.
Now, against the backdrop of difficult relations with the West, the question of refusing to import products becomes even more urgent.
The law is designed to oblige retailers to treat suppliers as domestic producers when forming orders.

Then we will go much faster and more confident on the way of import substitution, and the system of production planning for the necessary types of products will be created in a shorter time," deputy Oleg Nilov says.
Particularly effective quota mechanism will be for those agricultural sectors where the potential is particularly high, for example, in the dairy sector, where the share of imports was 25%.
Our farmers are really able to fully cover the entrances of Russian shops.
Furthermore, meat production can get a powerful impulse.
As is known, the largest share of imports remains on beef - from 30% to 35%.
It turns out, 65-70% are still accounted for by Russian products", - Kasyanova argues.
Experts are of the opinion that introduction of quotas for domestic products will facilitate import substitution and may accelerate this process.
However, in itself, this initiative will not lead to import substitution, as it requires a complex of measures, Litvinenko is sure.

In any case, 50% of the goods sold under this initiative can still be imported from abroad, which means that there will be no full import substitution, but significant steps will be taken in this direction.
In addition, it is not enough to set quotas, it is still necessary to set up domestic production in the country in order to meet these quotas.
These quotas will provide just such guarantees," the expert states.
Untimely diagnosis and lack of access to optimal treatment mean that ovarian cancer in rural areas kills more
Angelina Jolie and her brother James published a video commemorating their late mother, who died of ovarian cancer in 2007.
Women protecting themselves in rural Australia face a higher risk of death from ovarian cancer than those living in cities.
Researchers analyzed the disease maps of more than 1,100 Australian women diagnosed with ovarian cancer in 2005, finding that only 35 percent lived five years after the diagnosis.

Leading researcher Susan Jordan of the Institute of Medical Research QIMR Berghofer reported that the likelihood of dying during the study is 20 percent higher for those living in regions and remote areas of the state than for those living in urban areas.
NOTICE: New drugs can slow lung and ovarian cancer
The researchers followed the medical path of women for seven years.
Dr Jordan said that the age of the woman at the time of diagnosis, type of ovarian cancer, presence of current diseases and socio-economic status also influenced the likelihood of survival.
Older women and those who had cancer at a later stage at the time of diagnosis had the lowest survival rates.
For those who lived in regions or remote areas of the state, the probability of death during the study was 20 percent higher than for those who lived in urban areas.

Although the study was not intended to determine why women living outside cities are more likely to die of ovarian cancer, Dr Jordan suggested that premature diagnosis and lack of access to optimal treatment are possible factors.
"This disease is best treated by surgeons specializing in gynecological oncology, and they are mainly located in big cities," she said.

Despite improving the quality of telemedicine services to reduce the impact of distance, she suggested that increasing the number of outpatient services that would allow specialists to treat women closer to home, and support programs for people receiving treatment far from home, could help.

Dr Jordan said that regardless of geographical location, the study revealed that long life expectancy among women with ovarian cancer was rare, underlining the need for more effective treatment and prevention strategies.
The research, funded by Rio Tinto Ride to Conquer cancer, will be published today in the Medical Journal of Australia.
In March 2012, at the age of 33, a young mother from Gold Coast, Elise Neve, was told that she had aggressive forms of ovarian cancer.
In September, the new FAP will open its doors in Kuzhenersky District
Construction of a medical facility in the village of Toktaibelek was started in April of this year and was carried out on a typical project.
The cost of the works amounted to just over 10 million rubles.

According to the management of public relations and information of Head Mari El, the financing of construction of the facility was carried out at the expense of the republican budget in accordance with the targeted investment program.
The total area of the built medical and preventive institution is almost 230 square meters.
It will provide medical assistance to the inhabitants of eight settlements: the villages of Toktaibelek and the villages of Dementyevo, Puncherumal, Tunya, Fomichi, Toraibelek, Shinur and Chashkayal.
The new medical clinic will replace the existing FAP, which was built in 1918 and has long run out of resources, and its premises do not meet sanitary and hygienic requirements.
The new institution will open in the near future.
The murderer of the four-month-old son in the state of incontinence of Novocheboksary will appear before the court
The resident of Chuvashia will be on the scene of the defendants for the murder of her own child.
The investigation of a 31-year-old resident of Novocheboksary accused of causing death by negligence has been completed in Cheboksary.
The investigation found that on July 26, this year, the accused came together with a four-month-old son to celebrate the birthday of the child of her cousin in Cheboksary.
After a long stand, Novocheboksary decided to stay in the guests and laid the child to sleep.
When the baby woke up at night and cried, the unmarried woman placed him next to her on the bed to feed her breasts, but soon fell asleep.
During her sleep, the woman fell on her son, and he died of a stroke.
The criminal case has been referred to the court, the press service of the DSU of the Republic of Artsakh in Chuvash reported.
Inflation came out of the holidays.
Will Russians feel the sharp price rise
As a result of cross-border sanctions of Russia and the West, inflation in Russia will accelerate and will not fall into the forecasts of the authorities, VTB Capital analysts are convinced.
According to experts, the delayed consequences of the anti-sanctions will lead to inflation shock in the first quarter of 2015, RBC Daily writes.
According to the latest forecast of the Ministry of Economic Development, in 2014 inflation will be 6.5-7.5%, next year and even less - 6.5%.
However, according to the newspaper Kommersant, this week the MER should make "small but fundamental" adjustments to the macroeconomic forecast until 2017.
According to the publication, the agency may lower the estimate of inflation for 2015, which will allow to eliminate the expected strain of population income growth.
The forecast assumed that the food sanctions of the Russian Federation will be in force for a year - until August 2015.
How could such high inflation be assumed in such a situation?
The current situation suggests a different shock, but the downward trend of inflation will not change," the source of the newspaper in the Ministry of Finance said.
The economists from VTB Capital do not share the government's financial and economic bloc's expectations regarding inflation and forecast price growth in 2014 at 8%.
The main effect of the food bans will come together with the possible introduction of sales tax (VAT) in the regions of the Russian Federation in 2015, experts are convinced.
The inflation peak of 9% will be in February, after which the annual rate of price growth will go down, experts believe.
By the way, last week Rosstat summed up the first inflation results after the Russian Federation introduced "accurate sanctions".
AIF.ru asked experts and found their inflation expectations.
Artem Deev, Head of the analytical department of FC AForex:
Price increases are already observed in the main segments of goods.

Moreover, when socially important products became more expensive, the government was forced to introduce systemic price stability monitoring measures to prevent the risks of unjustified price increases in the short term.
Suppliers and retailers are already accounted for on a daily basis before regulators, so that the authorities know exactly who, when, and for what reason initiates price increases.

The key factors in the growth of the consumer price index continue to be the enormous rates of capital outflows, excessive refinancing of the banking sector by the Russian megaregulator, internal conversion due to the population flight to foreign currency, as well as the embargo on imports of food products from countries that joined the sanctions against Russia.
If inflationary pressure had remained under control, the price of a basket of the minimum set of products would not have jumped by 12% in just one quarter.
The ban on imports of foodstuffs provoked a supply shock in the domestic market and led to a perfectly logical increase in the final cost.

Since at the current stage we fail to fully implement the import substitution mechanism, as well as increase the self-sufficiency of the Russian market at the expense of domestic production, the response sanctions will continue to carry risks of inflationary component growth.

If we add to this the fiscal reasons for the lack of confidence in the national currency, as well as the worsening prospects for economic growth, inflation could well exceed 8% by the end of this year.
Alexander Razuvayev, Director of the analytical department of "Alpari"
In the 1990s, inflation sometimes reached 20-30% per month, in zero it was also higher than the current level, another thing that was then compensated by rapid economic growth.
I think, according to the results of the year inflation will be 8-8.5%.
Platon Maguta, Managing Director of Maguta Fund

The external factor linked to sanctions against Russia is still being successfully contained, but if further pressure is exerted, primarily on the financial sector, this may lead to certain difficulties and increase the inflation expectations of the population, which are usually traditionally expressed in cash purchases to secure their savings.

It can be assumed that the government, the Central Bank of the Russian Federation, and the Ministry of Finance will try to mitigate the smooth weakening of the ruble, both by market methods, and by state regulation.
But price growth traditionally begins after the summer recess and may become more tangible this autumn.
The target level of consumer inflation in Russia at 7.5% is likely to persist, as Russia still has financial savings.
Gardening centers are sorry for the decrease in number of homeowners

This decline, due to the exceptional reduction in the number of households under the age of 35, could lead to gardening centers losing tens of millions of pounds a year when today's young consumers reach "the basic age of gardening," according to a study by HTA, reported by the Financial Times.
According to the report, people renting housing spend on average 55 percent of the amount that owners of their own homes spend on gardening.

It mentions the increase in the number of people living in high urban areas without gardens, the popularity of paved courtyards in front of a parking house, and the reduction in garden sizes as other factors threatening the industry, which is estimated to have annual sales of £5 billion.
In Greater London, where the number of homeowners fell from 61 percent to 43 percent in six years, the UK’s lowest level of household consumption of garden goods.
HTA and the Royal Horticultural Society reported that renting housing and lack of garden space did not mean that people could not grow plants.
Guy Barter, chief gardening advisor at RHS, said: "Container planting, for example, is especially popular with tenants who can carry plants with them when they move."

The HTA report defined the period between 1997 and 2005 as the "golden age" of retail trade in horticultural goods as a result of the increase in the number of homeowners and economic prosperity from the late 1980s to the mid-1990s.
It also predicts that the market will improve this year due to better weather after adverse conditions in March and April last year.
The Ministry of Agriculture of Bulgaria has carried out a mass cleaning in the Fund "Agriculture"
Three of the four heads of the “Zemleделиe” fund were replaced on Friday.
In total, three of the four heads of the Farming Foundation were replaced on Friday.
Officially, the Bulgarian Ministry of Agriculture only announced the dismissal of the executive director Atanas Добреv.
His place was taken by Lausanne Vasiliev.
It turned out that on Friday two of the three deputy executive directors of the foundation were quietly replaced.
Tatiana Angelova, deputy executive director, who until now was in charge of state aid and SAPARD program, has been released, reports BGNES with reference to the newspaper "Labour".
I was not present on the board of directors of the fund because by law we are not members of the management, but I was later informed that I was released.
I cannot say why my dismissal is not reported on the Foundation website.
I am on vacation.
I hope to learn more on Monday," Angelova told the press.
She will be replaced by Ivanka Baghdatova, who has until now been the head of Investment Crediting in the central fund in “Zemleделиe” in Sofia.
Deputy Executive Director Nikolai Dachev was also released.
Until then, he was responsible for direct subsidies for fields paid by the EU.
In his place will be appointed Zhivko Zhivkov, who was the head of the regional directorate of the Fund "Zemledeliye" in the city of Great Ternovo until January 2014.
Only the deputy head of the foundation Atje Aliyeva-Veli has retained his post.
Currently it is responsible for the Rural Development Programme.
The official reasons for all changes in the department are not mentioned.
Turkey summons American diplomat in connection with report of espionage
The Turkish Foreign Ministry summoned the highest-ranking American diplomat in the country to explain the report on American and British espionage in Turkey.
Deputy Prime Minister Bulent said that an American prosecutor and Turkish officials discussed the message on Monday.

German magazine "Der Spiegel" and Internet magazine "The Intercept" reported that documents provided by former analyst of the U.S. National Security Agency Edward Snowden, show that Turkey was a priority intelligence target for U.S. and British intelligence services.
According to Turkish news agencies, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan downplayed the significance of this message, saying that all the leading countries spy on each other.
Earlier reports that the main German intelligence agency had also made Ankara an object of intelligence provoked more angry reactions from the Turkish government.
China's largest companies unite against Alibaba

Chinese companies, including the largest commercial real estate developer in China Dalian Wanda Group and Internet giants Tencent Holdings (network, messenger, etc.) and Baidu (the largest Chinese search engine), are creating a company that will compete in the online market with Alibaba.
But catching up with the miracle of the Chinese Internet, which has left behind even its American rivals - eBay and Amazon.com, will not be easy.
Union of the largest
The companies plan to invest in the joint venture 5 billion yuan ($814 million), 70% of it will be owned by Wanda and 15% - each of the Internet companies, said the Wanda Group statement.
The company is scheduled to be registered in Hong Kong.
The joint venture will combine Baidu's search engines with the popular social platform WeChat (China's largest social network with about 438 million users), Tencent and Wanda infrastructure.
In addition to a network of 40 luxury hotels, Wanda operates at least 49 commercial properties throughout China and 40 shopping malls.
Last year, the company invested 50 billion yuan (more than $8 billion) in the construction of a movie studio and a theme park in Qingdao (a city in eastern China on the Yellow Sea coast).
The project is expected to attract more than 1 million visitors annually and generate a profit of $960 million.
In addition, Wanda belongs to the American theater network AMC Entertainment Holdings, making the company the largest theater operator in the world.
By 2015, Wanda plans to equip all its own shopping malls, hotels and entertainment facilities with e-commerce services, which will be developed by the newly created competitor Alibaba.

According to Dong Tse, who will head the new company, thanks to the merger Wanda will be able to increase the number of users of its e-commerce services from the current 40 million people to 100 million by next year.
The new platform should become the largest online-to-offline platform in the world, says Don Tse.
The essence of online-to-offline (O2O) commerce is to attract buyers to the Internet so that they come to ordinary offline stores or purchase other traditional services.
A classic example of O2O are coupon sales services such as Groupon or Vigoda.ru.
"O2O is the largest "pearl" in online commerce," said head Wanda Wang Jianlin ( Bloomberg quote).
"At present, there is no real O2O site in China, and in this situation the chances are approximately equal," he believes.
China’s Internet trade market is the world’s largest, and McKinsey & Co. estimates that it will grow more than three times by 2015 compared to 2011, to $395 billion.
The number of Chinese Internet users has grown to 632 million, according to Bloomberg official statistics: this is more than the population of any country in the world except India.
And according to forecasts, by 2015 this number could rise to 850 million people.
Union of the Richest

The head of Tencent Ma Huatan until recently was the richest person in China, however, according to Bloomberg’s index of millionaires, the founder of Alibaba Jack Ma has already surpassed him by $5.5 billion.
Jack Ma's assets are estimated at $21.8 billion, of which $11 billion comes from his share in Alibaba.
Baidu leader Robin Li now ranks third among the richest people of China, while Wang Jianlin of Wanda - the fourth position of the rating.

"This battle is very interesting to observe: the three richest people are joining forces to challenge the even richer," said Bloomberg, director of China's e-commerce research center in Hangzhou, Cao Lai.
But he believes that the new company is unlikely to be able to compete seriously with Alibaba immediately after its creation: "The river cannot be built in one day."

It is not easy to compete with Alibaba, not only for new companies, but also for well-deserved global internet market leaders, as evidenced by the previous report on Alibaba’s financial performance for the last quarter.
Alibaba is often described as something intermediate between eBay and Amazon.com, but from April to June the Chinese company earned more than both its American competitors combined.
Alibaba's net profit over the period almost doubled the same cumulative indicator of competitors - it grew almost three times in the annual calculation and amounted to $1.99 billion.
"Alibaba still has huge potential for generating money, largely thanks to its mobile applications," - commented Bloomberg report analyst from Hong Kong's Arete Research Service.

According to Alibaba’s updated prospectus on the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission’s website, the number of active mobile users of the company’s services in July amounted to 188 million, significantly exceeding the March figure (163 million people).
At the same time, 32.8% of all Alibaba transactions in the past quarter were for mobile devices.
Alibaba will have to name the value of its shares before the IPO.
According to an average of 11 analysts surveyed by Bloomberg, the company can be valued at $187 billion after the sale of shares.
According to Bloomberg sources, Alibaba's debut on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) may already take place on September 16th.
The road-show of the company, preceding this event, will start on September 3.
It is expected that Alibaba's IPO will be a record in NYSE history and will allow the company to attract about $20 billion.
Until now, the record amount of funds raised on the US stock exchanges belonged to the Visa payment system, which in 2008 carried out the initial offering of its shares, earning $17.9 billion.
At least half of food products in trade networks should be Russian production, deputies of the State Duma believe.
They drafted a bill on this subject.
It is about amendments to Article 8 of the Federal Law "On the Basics of State Regulation of Trade Activities in the Russian Federation" and to the Tax Code.
The purpose of the document is to introduce protective measures against Russian food producers.
Important clarification, according to the bill, at least 50 percent of products of domestic production in stores should be for each kind of goods.

However, the document will take into account that there are goods that are not produced in Russia, for example, vegetables and fruits in the winter, so for them will be made a "discount" to avoid possible discomfort for buyers.

At the same time, the draft law amends the Tax Code of the Russian Federation, establishing a reduced rate of VAT in the amount of 10% for the sale of all food products, the country of origin of which is Russia, the newspaper “Izvestiya” reports.

On August 27, the lower chamber of the parliament introduced a draft law on amendments to the Federal Law "On Retail Markets", which proposes to revive farming markets in Russia, where small producers will be able to sell their products.
Chief of Police of Magaloff charged with corruption
The inhabitants presented evidence of extortion by police and officials of the municipality of Calvia to the office of the Public Prosecutor of Mallorca on Friday.

The police chief of Calvia on the resort island of Mallorca was arrested as a result of charges of corruption by businessmen and bar owners at the notorious centre of unbridled drunkenness in Magalupe.

Chief Inspector José Antonio Navarro was detained as a result of corruption charges brought against him by several businessmen from Punta Ballena, the street where most of the bars and nightclubs of Magalhães are located.

According to the daily online edition Mallorca Diario, the plaintiffs presented evidence of extortion by police and officials of the municipality of Calvia to the office of the Prosecutor of Mallorca for the fight against corruption on Friday.
Two more local police officers were arrested by the guards of the Spanish National Guard on charges of corruption and will be questioned by a judge along with Navarro.
The Spanish daily ABC reported that dissatisfied owners of nightclubs say that protectionism on the part of the authorities seriously reflects the state of their business.
"It is no longer a question of earning money, it is a question of survival," one of the businessmen told the court.
Our sources of existence cannot be threatened.
We have nothing to lose.
Magaloff made international press headlines this summer after a popular YouTube video that showed an 18-year-old British vacationer leaving 24 men behind while running around bars.
The island's authorities have since attempted to stop the unhealthy hooliganism among the resting people of Magalpha, minimizing the number of notorious alcoholic bar races.
In addition, Playhouse, where the mine incident occurred, was forced to close for a year, while Playhouse and Carnage bar racing organizers were fined €55,000 ($73,000).

The tourist resort of Magaloff, mainly popular among young British holidaymakers, has also been the site of numerous accidents in alcoholic state related to the insane amusement known as "balconying", when people jump from one balcony to another or from the balcony to the hotel pool.
The first day of spring was marked by wet and windy conditions affecting flights to Adelaide Airport
WESNA prepared a cold surprise in southern South Australia, bringing torrential rains and strong winds that affected flights to Adelaide Airport.
Another 5 mm of rain fell on the city at night until 9 pm, following the 6.6 mm that fell on Sunday night.
The last rains were preceded by a couple of short rains with gusty winds, including a thunderstorm that began shortly before 8 p.m. and poured nearly 4 mm in about 10 minutes.
After the winter delivered the early portion of spring last week, the temperature dropped again on Monday to a maximum of just 15.8C in the city.
The squalor conditions are believed to have been one of the reasons for the delay in boarding Virgin Airlines flight from Melbourne to Adelaide.

The plane had to land on schedule immediately after 7:30 pm, but fell into a wind shift zone - a sudden change of speed or direction of the wind at a short distance - and was forced to raise the altitude.
Wind gusts reached 50 km/h on the ground at Adelaide Airport at this time.
Flight data showed that the aircraft had to raise altitude during the second landing, and the aircraft finally landed at about 8:40 p.m.
The delay caused the subsequent delay of several other flights, including Emirates from Dubai and Qantas from Sydney.
Maximum 16C is forecast in Adelaide on Tuesday with a probability of one or two rains.
The accounting of construction facilities in the Russian Federation will take place in a new way
Issues of pricing, regulation of the construction industry, as well as problems of connection to networks are under special control of the Federal Antitrust Service.
The FAS has established an expert council for the development of competition in the construction sector.

At its meeting the head of the department of control of public utilities, construction and natural resources of the FAS Vadim Solovyev stated that "today's calculation of the construction objects list is absolutely incomprehensible".
The regulatory framework makes pricing opaque and can lead to unreasonable construction price, the FAS believes.

And offer to determine the cost of construction of state-owned objects at the design stage on the basis of market prices of constructive solutions instead of the currently applied estimate norms and uniform prices for technological operations.
These proposals have been included in the road map and are now under consideration in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
"The replacement of traditional estimate documentation in construction to calculations of structural elements should lead to less corruption in the industry," Vadim Solovyev explained.

After all, now in the account is counted every bolt and hook, and it does not always seem possible to check everything, so sometimes in the documentation unfair construction companies can dig "full tractors".
The Minster agrees with the FAS.

"The first developments on the transition to the calculation of the cost on the components already exist: methods for the calculation of the prices on the construction solutions, the preparation of estimates on these indicators have been developed," said Elena Zhukova, Head of the Department of Urban Development and Architecture of the Ministry of Construction.
The field of road construction was chosen as a pilot.
However, experts believe that the problem is much more serious.
As the head of the construction company "Profi-invest" Anatoly Demyanko told "RGB", the estimated standards are long outdated, but another mechanism is not yet offered to the business.
"As for the proposed calculations on the structural elements, in practice it is difficult to implement, because when buildings are often used completely different technologies," - he believes.
It is no secret that the construction market develops largely thanks to public procurement.
In the opinion of the Chairman of the Board of NPP "Expert Society of Public Procurement Professionals" Ekaterina Lezina, today the state is the most payable customer.

Vladimir Malakhov, Deputy Director of Engineering of the Russian Capital Development Branch, pointed out that today the market is conditionally divided into companies that have access to contract portfolios and companies that have monopoly competences and do not allow competitors in this field.
He believes that creating a transparent market is possible only if access to contracts is maximized by someone managing influence.

At the expert council it was proposed to form a system of public procurement in such a way that the same performer is not entitled to receive more than one contract in the amount of more than 1 billion rubles or several contracts in the amount of more than 1 billion rubles.
The Ministry believes that this approach should be evaluated from the point of view of impact on business, as well as the efficiency of construction management.

As Elena Zhukova explained, in this case it will be necessary to entrust the customer with the functions of the general contractor, which will lead to an increase in the staff number of the customer and budget expenditures on its maintenance.
At the same time, the customer’s specialists will have the knowledge to evaluate the quality of the works performed by contracting organizations, as well as their safety.
Often, it will be necessary to determine who will be responsible for the safety of the facility as a whole.

In addition, this approach may lead to the withdrawal of highly skilled public procurement participants due to their unwillingness to receive a public order for a limited volume of work and a small amount of contract.

Deputy Head of the Expert and Advisory Center of the Institute of Procurement Alexander Evstashenkov believes that the procedure of public procurement has now turned into a business game for the attention of the contractor.

And he gave the following example: "the participant must specify "specific indicators" when filling in the application without specifying the words: "or equivalent", "must be", "from", "more", "less", "analogous", "or", "type", "analogous type", "not below", "below", "above", "may", "may have", "may be", "before", "not before", "not above", "not allowed", etc.
Thus, customers often abuse their right to set requirements for the content of an application submitted by contracting organizations.
Another problem of 44-FZ, according to Evstashenkov, became the need to evaluate the quality of work through the "paper" proposal of the participant at the stage of application.

Considering the application of the participant, it is really possible to evaluate only the qualification of the contractor, but not the quality of the works, which have not even begun to be carried out, - the expert believes.
The quality of the works can only be assessed when they are received.
The expert council also suggested shifting marginal income from top to bottom to eliminate intermediate contractors.
The Chairman of the Expert Council, State Secretary, Deputy Director of the FAS Andrey Tsarikovsky believes that this should not be done, as the contractor is responsible for the order.
Otherwise it will happen, as in the famous reprimand of Arkady Rikin "Atel": "There are claims to buttons?".
Israeli children return to school after the war in Gaza

Thousands of Israeli children in areas adjacent to the Gaza Strip went to school again on Monday after spending the summer in bomb shelters when rockets and rain mines fell on their settlements during the 50-day war between Israel and Hamas, while schools in the Gaza Strip remained closed as the area recovered after the fighting.
The beginning of school classes brought a sense of joy and excitement to the rocket-affected settlements of southern Israel, but the effects of the fighting remained fresh.
In the southern city of Ashdod, employees of the Pashosh kindergarten, which was hit by a rocket, removed the marks of shells from the walls and children's wheels before the arrival of the students.
“We’re a little scared, but we’re looking forward to the future,” said Ronit Bart, a resident of Kibutsa Sad and an English teacher at his school.
Many children in our area really need to return to a life of scale.
Her 11-year-old daughter, Shani Bart, said she suddenly started to go to school again "not very strange".
"It was a difficult time, and we did not leave our homes at all," she said.
President Reuven Rivlin visited Kibutz, which is located near the border with Gaza, to express his support.

Before the ceasefire ended the war last week, thousands of residents of border settlements such as Sa'ad did not take to the streets or leave their homes, moving to safer areas beyond the Gaza Strip to escape rocket and mortar fire.
Many inhabitants of Nahal Oz, a settlement near the border with Gaza where a four-year-old boy was killed by a cluster of Palestinian mines, doubt that they should return.
The Ministry of Education reported that about a dozen families still have not returned.
Their children were sent to other schools at that time.
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visited a school in Sderot, a city on the border with Gaza that was heavily damaged by the Palestinian fire.
He advised the children to study diligently and said, "We will do everything possible to give you knowledge and ensure your safety."
Israel and Hamas agreed on an immediate ceasefire last Tuesday.

The ceasefire immediately ended the fighting, but key issues remained unresolved, such as Hamas' demand that the Egyptian-Israeli blockade of Gaza be lifted and that airports and seaports be opened in the Gaza Strip.
Israel wants Hamas to lay down weapons and return the bodies of two Israeli soldiers killed in the war.
It is expected that a new phase of indirect negotiations will begin later this month in Egypt.
More than 2100 Palestinians, three quarters of whom were peaceful citizens, and at least 494 children, were killed in the war, according to estimates by the Palestinian side and the UN.
Israel disputes these figures and claims that at least half of those killed were militants; however, it has not provided substantive evidence to support this claim.
Israeli casualties included 66 soldiers and six civilians, including one Thai worker.
During the fighting Hamas and other Gaza fighters fired 4591 missiles and mines on Israeli cities, mainly in the south of the country.
The Israeli army, meanwhile, carried out more than 5,000 air and other attacks.

As a result of the Israeli attacks, thousands of homes in the Gaza Strip have been damaged and destroyed, and an estimated 250,000 people have found shelter in more than 100 schools that have been converted into shelters.
Due to the fact that tens of thousands of people were still in shelters and fighting continued, officials responsible for education delayed the start of the school year last week.

“I hope that the school will open soon so that we can complete our education as children from all over the world and Jewish children,” said Mohammad Amara, a 13-year-old boy who now lives in one of Gaza’s schools.
According to the popular criterion of real estate prices showed the biggest winter growth in seven years.
The housing price index of RP Data CoreLogic Hedonic for housing prices in the Australian capital rose by 1.1 percent in August, RP data reported on Monday.
This increase resulted in a aggregate increase of 4.2 percent in June, July and August, the largest increase in winter months since 2007.
Annual price growth amounted to 10.9 percent, more than double the 12 month growth by August 2013, but the increase was not evenly distributed across the country.
Research Director of RP Data Tim Lauless said that Sydney and Melbourne have a two-tier market.
RP Data figures show that Sydney’s housing prices have risen by 16.1 percent over the past year, while Melbourne’s – by 11.7 percent.
The following markets were Adelaide, Brisbane, and Darwin, where prices rose from five to six percent on average.
At the other end of the scale was Canberra, where government spending cuts occurred, where prices rose by only 1.4 percent per year.
Mr. Lawless said that now that spring has begun, there will be an increase in the number of real estates on sale over the next few months, which will be a "real test" for the market.

"Taking into account the current high rate of auction sales, the overall high rate of sales and the current low interest rate conditions, it is likely that the cost of housing will rise in the next three months," he said.
How people live in the oldest house of Ufa
In the former house of gold producers and miners Evdokim and his son Ivan Demidov on October Revolution Street 57/1 (the former Bolshoy Kazanskaya) 18 apartments.
The 18th-century house has not changed much since it was built, except for its old age.

The outsiders walk here as if on an excursion, and the inhabitants suffer more than rejoice from their privilege - the right to live in the old Ufim house, whose walls will be remembered by Colonel Alexander Suvorov.
The date of construction of the house is uncertain, historians point to two dates - 1730 and 1737.
But in any case, it turns out that the building is less than 300 years old.
The old courtyard, always open door, swinging staircase.
The doors of the apartments are located close to each other, the walls have cracked, and the street can be seen in the lights from the covered plaster.
It seems that everything is kept to the honest word.
And the inhabitants of the land say, "It does not seem to you that it is so."
It is very difficult to live in an 18th-century wooden house, says Tatiana Lukianova, a resident of apartment No. 3.
The object is on state reserve, but the money for its maintenance is not spent for decades, and we feel like museum exhibits, which the authorities simply forgot.
The last repair was 40 years ago.
The walls were still tight, but the foundations were all burned.
Many residents still go to the toilet on the street and bathe once a week in the public bath.
How can we be satisfied in such conditions?!
The road passes directly under the windows, there is not even a pedestrian zone.
Tatiana moves the curtain.
Now you can see what was only heard before: under the windows there is a flow of cars.
You can see that the windows are always cracked, we can't open the windows, and we're used to noise.
Man is used to everything, good and bad.
Our apartment is still exemplary, thanks to the husband, his hands are gold.
Moreover, we have two rooms, we live in three with our son.
And in other families the conditions are much worse, on the second floor in general ceilings are slightly more than one and a half meters high.
For contrast Tatiana offers to enter the guest to the neighbor from apartment No 6 Ludmila Starostina.
A pleasantly hospitable woman from the front offers a cup of coffee and with a sad smile tells:
We have one bedroom apartment, 14.5 m2 for four people, so we live: we with husband and daughter with granddaughter.

I've been here since I was born, there has never been another flat, - Lyudmila turns her eyes around the room: an antennas, two sofas with the letter "g"; on one of them lay a granddaughter with a laptop.
Very close and little different from the usual domestic interior: only ceilings beautiful, "historic".
But from the ceiling regularly flows: the water supply system is no use.
Lyudmila talks about her apartment as usual and astonishingly simultaneously as an Italian woman whose house stands on Roman ruins.
That is, it merges into one very old and recent, everyday and legendary:
The water pipeline was completed about 40 years ago during the last renovation.
Then they made us a small kitchen in the dining room and a toilet from the former cellar.
We live exactly where Demidov and his family lived, on the second floor there were servants.
Our apartment is not private, and why?
The Ufa Property Center says that privatization is not important.
However, we will only get a one-bedroom apartment, we cannot claim a larger one.
Four months ago, we were promised to settle, but no further promises were made.
I'm not used to complaining and I won't.
In this apartment (room!) lived a whole dynasty: my grandmother with grandfather, mother with father, I with husband and my daughter with granddaughter.
Everything happened during this time.
For example, healthy rats ran around the kitchen.
Look at the steel walls, they are meters thick!
It is said that the solution was mixed on the eggs, so it holds so long.
The house is built thoroughly, thank you Demidov!
Probably, that's the only reason no one has been killed by the collapsed ceiling or porch.

Only the construction is still slowly dying in our eyes: the boards and logs of the house are rotting, the floors have fallen repeatedly, we have poured cement, but all is useless - the solution goes into the ground like a well.
It is said that it is - under our room a secret climb and a walk to the White River, which was made specially by the old men who once lived here, to be able to hide from danger, if necessary.
They were persecuted.
Lyudmila Starostina tells how a historian came to them, pleaded to let him start the excavation in the apartment.
And then he persuaded them to give them a flat in exchange for their one-room apartment on the Avenue of October.
Lyudmila refused to tell the historian:
Where are we four in one?
And here though there is a small hope that will give housing more spacious.
If we agree to exchange, we won't win anything.
However, the family did not win anything.
The biggest dream of Ludmila was to have them displaced, and the daughter with a 16-year-old granddaughter were given a separate room.
That is, two families were divided into two-room apartments instead of the not the most magnificent ruins in which two generations live now.
The charming, miniature girl Olesya Karsakova from apartments No 11 and 12 shows the second floor of the house.
There is a large family living in two cozy 23 m2 flats called apartments.
We are seven people, two children.
You can see what the conditions are.
As with window frames, the scaffolding is washed away by pieces, with holes in the kitchen walls and in the rooms.
The water in the tap is only cold all year round.
If you walk through the apartments of the oldest house of Ufa, you can be sure that the most fortunate of the spouses of Lavrentyev from apartment No. 4.
They occupy the most spacious rooms on the first floor.
You are right, there are plenty of places!
The accommodation is 75 square meters and has three people.
We live in exactly the rooms where Suvorov was supposed to stay during his stay in Ufa, - says the head of the family Alexander Dmitryevich Lavrentyev.
The roofs are high, spacious.
One bad thing - everything around cracks, breaks down, breaks down.
The neighbors probably already told!
Most of our suffering is with the floors: wooden boards burned, the ground literally went from under our feet.
I put the supports, the cords; nothing else in the hall, and in the other room we walk, as we climb on the swings, so it is all tense.
Alexander Dmitrievich can tell about the house of the merchant Evdokim Demidov better than any guide.
The gold industry refers to it as the native, speaks about it with admiration.
Indeed, the personality was unruly: the owner of the Kaginsky and Uzansky factories built houses, poured guns and bells, held Ural mines.
The ancestors of the merchant real estate ancestor are proud, but do not want to live under one roof with history anymore.
I settled here as a child, in the 40s of the 20th century, - says Alexander Dmitrievich.
Then around stood wooden spaces for carts, horses and caravans, later demolished.
In 1968 they wanted to remove our house too, but something prevented...
The story repeated in 2014: once again they were seized by new housing.
We, as a team, gathered all the documents, took care of the necessary authorities, and suddenly learned that the move to the apartment is being moved to 2015 or 2016.
We don't believe in all this anymore...
Two years ago Lavrentyev went to the Ministry of Culture of the Republic of Bashkortostan to learn about the fate of the house.
The officers did not accept the residence.
They sent from one table to another, and then, as a joke, gave out a paper without signature and seal: "The Ministry of Culture does not object to the displacement of residents."
I even had the feeling that our house is no longer in the city plan, after all it was under number 57, then became 57 A, and now 57/1.
It was demolished in the 1970s.
"Russian Planet" has contacted Vladimir Barabash, head of the information and analytical work of the Ufa Land Resources Department.
The house on October Revolution Street 57/1 is included in the program of demolition of old housing.
I cannot answer for the actions of officials of the 1970s, only know that at that time there was a plan to destroy all old houses, despite historical significance.

Fortunately, this has not happened, and the decision of the modern authorities - to restore all the old houses on October Revolution Street, representing architectural value - is successfully carried out.
Residents are expected to move to new apartments in the near future.
According to Barabash, the restoration of Dom Demidov will be carried out by Italian specialists who have participated in the restoration of buildings in Venice.
Now in Italy there is an architectural biennale, and the project "Old Ufa" is presented there among others.
I hope that by 2016 the entire old Kazan street will be restored, - says the official.
The houses will have a proper view, corresponding to the one that was before, three centuries ago.
Dom Demidov is likely to become a museum open to all.
In addition, the government decided to make the street pedestrian on weekends.
In the morning, unfortunately, it will not work, too much traffic in the city.
To resettle people from the future museum Vladimir Barabash promises in 2015.
However, they are unlikely to be satisfied: their new apartments will be on the same square as the present ones.
Only from another era.
A forest fire started in Primorsky due to a thunderstorm
The drought caused a forest fire on the territory of the Hunting Precinct Forestry in the Fire District of the Primorsky Krai.
At the site of the burning there is an increase in the grouping of forces and means.
According to the management of the Coastal Aviation Base, the conditions created on the site of the fire require the involvement of aviation forces.
Vasily Medvedev, Deputy Chief of the Air Base:
The fire, which broke out in an inaccessible area, was detected by a surveillance pilot on board the patrol aircraft An-2 on an area of 3 hectares.
The wooden remains are burned on the old burner.
The high humidity of the area and the steep slopes of more than 45 degrees, the absence of suitable firefighter landing sites create considerable difficulties in shaving.
A Mi-8 helicopter is required.

After the fire was detected, four parachute firefighters were immediately deployed to the site.
The main task of the specialists is to extinguish the fire and prepare the site for the delivery of additional fire fighting forces and means.

As soon as the helicopter landing site in the area of the fire is ready, specialists will be moved to the site of the blaze, the website of the administration of the Primorsky Krai reports.

Kenya registers civil servants to identify "invisible workers"
Kenya has started a biometric registration of all civil servants in an attempt to remove "invisible workers" from the government's payment notification.
Employees who are not registered for the next two weeks will no longer be paid, the government statement states.
The government suspects that thousands of people continue to receive salaries after leaving the state service.
President Uharu Kenyata promised to reduce corruption in government structures after coming to power in 2013.
An audit earlier this year found that at least $1 million (£700,000) a month is lost due to payments to "invisible workers" and other financial irregularities.
The government suspects that wages continue to flow into bank accounts even after a person dies or leaves state service, reports BBC reporter Vanyama Chebusiri from the capital, Nairobi.

All civil servants must appear in the identification centres within the next two weeks to ensure that their data will be collected by biometric registration procedure, is reported in the government statement.
Anyone who fails to do so without a decent reason will be removed from the payment notice and will be informed thereof.

"This procedure will significantly facilitate the rationalization of the public service by determining the actual number of public servants, and will also be used to clear the payment accounts at both levels of government - hence ending the problem of 'invisible workers'," said Ann Weiguru, Secretary of the Cabinet of Ministers for Planning and Power Structuring.
Tens of Turkish police officers arrested in connection with "conspiracy" against the government
A total of 33 police officers were detained in Turkey on suspicion of "conspiracy against the government", local news agencies reported.
Police officials did not immediately comment on this information.
Among the detainees were 14 high-ranking officers, according to Hurriet Daly News.
Some of them participated in corruption detection activities last December, which were aimed at checking government officials, including four government ministers.
In July, several Turkish police officers were arrested on suspicion of forming an organised criminal group and listening to a telephone.
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan (who was then Prime Minister) defined their actions as part of measures taken against him and other in power, Islamic cleric Fatullah Gülen.

On September 1, the ceremony was not held in every school.
There is no peaceful sky above every part of Ukraine.
We must fight for a peaceful sky.
All Ukraine, a huge united Ukrainian People's Front, must fight for a peaceful sky.
Alexan Pastohov, the director of the school in Slavyansk, to which Yatsenyuk's daughter went, spoke Russian.

Perry from Texas says the humiliating tweet was written by someone outside

A tweet from the confirmed account of Texas Republican Governor Rick Perry on Sunday evening contained an insulting image of the District Prosecutor from the Democrats, who is at the center of criminal prosecution on charges of abuse of power.
The tweet was later deleted, followed by another one from Perry's account, in which it was deactivated.
Just from my account was posted a tweet that was written by someone outside.
"I don't like this tweet, and I removed it," says a later note.
Perry's assistants did not immediately respond to messages asking to comment.

An earlier tweet contained a mock caricature of District Attorney Travis Rosemarie Lemberg, who was found guilty of driving drunk in April 2013.
Perry imposed a ban on funding her agency when she refused to resign, leading to a grand jury trial in Austin this month against Perry, who is a potential presidential candidate in the 2016 election.

The signature in the tweet reads: "I don't always drive a car in a state of drunkenness 3 times the permissible alcohol level in the blood... but when I do that, I charge Governor Perry for what he tells me about it."
I am the drunkest Democrat in Texas.
Lemberg did not conduct an investigation involving a grand jury against Perry.
It was appointed by Michael McCrum, a special prosecutor from San Antonio, who was appointed a Republican judge.
Perry did not plead guilty and called the accusations political mischief.

His powerful legal team asked the judge conducting the case to reject the indictment, stating that the law used to prosecute a governor who has been serving his duties for the longest time in the history of Texas would reveal that it was contrary to the constitution.
Perry stopped funding $7.5 million from the state's Public Control Department, which is based in Travis County and investigates corruption in the Texas public sector, when Lemberg refused to resign.
The veto prompted an official complaint from the left-wing public control group.
Perry's confirmed account tape is often updated - and sometimes becomes famous.

Berkeley reports that the real estate market has returned to "normal condition"
One of London’s most famous developers warned that the real estate market in south-eastern England has “returned” to normal activity.

Houses in the capital were the subject of intense demand and rapidly rising prices, with widespread fears that the credit bubble would push the Bank of England to impose mortgage restrictions in June.

Tony Pagely, founder and chairman of the elite construction company Berkeley, said on Monday, "Since the beginning of the current financial year, the market has returned to a normal level of transactions since the peak of 2013," adding that this has provided "a stable working environment".
The London real estate market succeeded during the recession as foreign buyers moved to the capital.
Prices in the city jumped by 18.5 percent just last year, according to the Land Cadastre, significantly surpassed the average figure of 6.7 percent in England and Wales as a whole.
Average market prices for Berkeley private, affordable, and student schemes rose by about a fifth last year, reaching £423,000 at the end of April.

However, the pound’s strengthening in recent months has made London real estate less attractive to foreign buyers, some of whom have also stopped introducing new real estate taxes and political rhetoric around a potential “home tax” ahead of the general election next May.

Last week, the London real estate agency Foxtons warned that the April mortgage market reform, which introduced tougher loan terms, would also result in a decline in market growth both in real estate purchases and prices in the second half of the year.
Fresh data from Bank of England on Monday showed a decline in the number of approved mortgage loans in June, suggesting further cooling in the housing market.
Hamptons International, another real estate agency, has reduced its 2015 London real estate price growth forecast to 3 percent on the basis that real estate prices are already starting to weaken.
Meanwhile, transaction volumes dropped by a quarter compared to the previous year in London's most expensive areas, such as Chelsea, Mayfair and Kensington, according to WA Ellis.
Nevertheless, the demand for houses in the capital proved very profitable for Berkeley, increasing sales by more than £2.2 billion.
Mr. Pigley added: "The demand for the right product with the best design and the best location remained the same and, reflecting this, the long-term sales remained."
In June, the company reported that it sold 3742 new houses this year until the end of April - almost a third more than in the pre-crisis peak of 2007.
Annual pre-tax profit rose by 40 percent compared to the previous year to £380 million, income - by 18 percent to £1.6 billion.
Speaking on Monday before the company’s annual meeting, Mr. Pidgeley said that Berkeley’s projected revenues for this year would be in line with current market expectations.
According to the unanimous opinion of analysts, the profit for the whole year before tax is expected to be £450 million.
Berkeley stocks were held at £23.96 on the London Stock Exchange in the second half of the day.

Twenty years before the above-mentioned events or so, Esme Nussbaum, a wise and energetic 32-year-old researcher who worked at Offnau, the unofficial public mood control agency, prepared a small report on the preservation of low and medium levels of violence in the very areas of the country where it was expected to decline, if not completely, given the resources and powers allocated to eradicate it.

Lesotho army says the coup was not planned; prime minister remains in South Africa

Representatives of the Lesotho army denied the fact that a coup was being prepared to overthrow the government, stating that they were acting against the police suspected of trying to arm political fanatics.
Prime Minister Thomas Tabane left the country, claiming that the country's army had surrounded his official residence and seized government buildings in the capital, Maseru.
The Prime Minister took his family to neighbouring South Africa, declaring that he had been threatened with suicide.
The army's representative, Major Nelle Ntoy, stated that there was in fact no coup, but that the army responded to the threat from "political fanatics" whom the police tried to arm.

"What happened this morning is that the command of the Lesotho Armed Forces took action, having received several intelligence reports that there are some elements among the police forces who are really planning to armed some political, young fanatics of political parties who were ready to create chaos," he told the Voice of America.
A representative of the South African government, Clayson Monella, stated that the army's actions looked like a coup.
"While no one has claimed the seizure of power by force, according to all information, the actions of Lesotho's armed forces at the moment have major signs of a coup," he said.
Army representatives in Lesotho reported that the soldiers returned to the barracks on Sunday and that the capital was calm.
Meanwhile, Deputy Prime Minister Mottejoa Metsing manages the government in the absence of Taban.
Tabane stated that he believed he was being attacked in connection with an attempt to fight corruption in the country.
The situation in Lesotho has been very tense since June, when Tabane suspended parliamentary sessions as a result of disagreements within his coalition government.
He stated that his actions did not undermine the government, despite accusations of the contrary.

Eurozone production at the lowest level in 13 months
Production growth in the eurozone slowed to the lowest indicator for 13 months in August, according to a popular survey.
The latest Markit value of the eurozone industrial sector’s business activity index (PMI) fell to 50.7 in August, down from 51.8 in July.
The value above 50 indicates growth.
New orders were delayed, and the enterprises suffered amid growing tensions between the EU and Russia in connection with Ukraine.
The figures came before the European Central Bank (ECB) meeting on Thursday.
Markets will expect a clear plan from the bank on how to deal with the eurozone’s breakdown recovery, as well as the risk of deflation at an inflation rate of just 0.3%.

It is speculated that ECB head Mario Draghi may give additional signals later this week that he is considering a quantitative easing scheme for the eurozone similar to that used by the United Kingdom and the United States during the financial crisis.

"While some growth is better than no growth at all, the braking effect of growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty on producers is becoming more obvious," said Rob Dobson, senior Markit economist.
PMI of the German manufacturing sector, Russia’s largest trading partner in the EU, fell to the lowest for 11 months mark of 51.4.
Meanwhile, in the bloc’s second-largest economy, France, the PMI fell to 46.9.
France continues to cause real concern, as does Italy’s weakening from stable growth to stagnation.
The signs that the growth momentum has declined mainly in the industrial engine, Germany, as well as in Spain and the Netherlands, also does not add confidence," Mr. Dobson said.
The slowdown in the industry is likely to fuel further speculation by analysts expecting additional monetary or fiscal stimulus.
One positive news came from Ireland, where the PMI rose to 57.3, its highest level since the end of 1999.
Howard Archer, chief economist at IHS Global Insight, said: “The best thing to say about the August survey of the eurozone industry activity index is that it shows that the sector is still growing.”

He added: "Eurozone producers obviously find life very difficult at the moment, as the current rising geopolitical tension - especially related to Russia/Ukraine - adds uncertainty to the still difficult conditions in many countries.
This increased tension has obviously hit business – and especially consumer confidence – and is likely to lead to some orders being delayed or even cancelled, especially large orders.
He said that "it seems increasingly likely that the ECB will eventually have to carry out some kind of quantitative easing, although we suspect it will be limited."

"In 2006 I worked with psychologists, and I felt a little better after that, but I can't forget it.
And I would like to forget.

I lost consciousness.
I would never go there again, and please do not ask me to show you where I was sitting on this famous photo.
Survivor: Georgy Farniev today with an open photo of himself in the hospital after the capture
My pain is great, and I carry it with me every day.

My second interest was animals, so I went to the veterinary institute.

He learns to treat all animals "from cats to cows".
He said, "I know that I will never tell my children about my experience.

His mother Marina, 42, said, "This pain never leaves me.
It is worse in my soul when the anniversary is approaching.

I waited for him at home and could not help.
I am so grateful to God that he has returned to me.
He remains with us.
George is now an adult, but this nightmare is still with him.
It is hard to accept when something so terrible and unfair happens to you.
He is a boy, he loves sports, but can't do them because of his knees.
He has had several operations, he can walk, but can not engage in sports.
I would say that he overcame this nightmare by 50%, but it is impossible to completely overcome and forget it.
This awful experience will remain with us.
Many friends and neighbors were killed during the capture, and this only exacerbates my pain.
I lost a lot of people I knew well and who were dear to me.
My son is with me, and it is the best gift that God could give me, but my heart is grieved for those who were killed.
I know families where new children were born, but I also know widows who have never married again.
It's hard to accept that life goes on, even if you don't want it.
I will never forget how my heart jumped out of my chest when I saw him in the hospital.
Now I look at what is happening in the world - wars in different regions.

Why do they kill each other?

If it were possible to capture all the insurgents and throw them out - as far as possible.

4 tips on how to get better quality underwater photos and videos
If you want to take photographs or video underwater, you have before you a variety of equipment options.
The cheapest option is a waterproof "cleaner", such as Nikon Coolpix AW120, or an extreme camera, such as GoPro Hero3+ Silver Edition, both of which are sold for about $300.
I took these pictures on a family holiday with several cameras, all for about $350.
Regardless of which equipment you use, there are a few rules to follow in order to achieve the best results.
Check your equipment.
Even if you have a waterproof camera, make sure that the battery of the camera and other compartments are tightly closed.
Additionally, set your camera to the type of photos or videos you want to shoot.
Some cameras have camera modes or object types that optimize exposure for darkened underwater conditions.
And before jumping into the water, see how deep your equipment can sink.
Some cameras are designed for only 5 feet, others - 50 or 60 feet.
Take a look at our customer guide and ratings of digital cameras for both traditional and waterproof models.
Take a few shots - because many of them will not get.
The "baths" have LCDs that will help you to compile images, whereas the "exhn cameras" usually do not.
Even if you have LCD, it will be difficult to see underwater, and composing the frame will be a random process.
So make a few frames.
Also, if your camera has a serial mode that takes several shots with slightly different exposure settings, use it.
Stay on the surface.
The amount of light decreases significantly as you dive deeper into the water.
If possible, stay at the surface when you film in a pool, river or ocean.
This will also allow you to transfer more colors on the photos; the deeper you go, the less colors you will see.
Swim closer to the shooting objects.
This is a great advice for shooting on land, but it is even more important underwater due to darkened light conditions.

Especially important if you are shooting on an X-ray camera: This equipment is often equipped with a fixed wide-angle lens, which means that you will have to get closer to the shooting objects if you want to fill the frame.
