Poles handed over more than 400 prisoners to the Ukrainian military
In the "Army of Novorossia" claim that killed Ukrainian Su-27, and accuse the opponent of violating the ceasefire agreement
As of 10 a.m. on 1 September, the rebels handed over 402 prisoners to the Ukrainian side, 72 of whom were wounded, as well as the bodies of 35 soldiers killed.
This was reported to Interfax by the representative of the press service of the Army of Novorossia.
He added that "a Su-27 aircraft violating the ceasefire agreement was shot down by air defense forces in the area of the settlement of Mereshka".
According to the interlocutor of the agency, the Ukrainian side in the artillery bombardment of Lugansk airport applied the ammunition prohibited by international conventions.

The representative of the press service noted that during the night the militants managed to damage two helicopters of the Ukrainian Air Force at one of the field airfields, as well as destroy two armoured vehicles and two ammunition warehouses.
"Losses in the enemy's livestock - up to a hundred people killed and wounded, 13 people were taken prisoner," - summarized the representative of the headquarters.
Interfax does not have confirmation of this information from Ukrainian sources.

On Sunday the armed formations of the "national republics" of Donbass declared the transfer of 223 prisoners of war and soldiers of the National Guard of Ukraine to the Ukrainian side within the framework of compliance with the ceasefire regime.

At the same time during the night, the DNR army, according to the "Army of Novorossia", "intercepted the attempt of the National Guards in violation of previously reached agreements to remove heavy equipment from the surrounding area".
At that time, the militias reported the destruction of two tanks and two BMPs, the seizure of six tanks and the disarmament of 198 soldiers.

According to the headquarters, the total casualties of the enemy in all directions (Donetsk, Lugansk, Mariupolsk) for that night amounted to five tanks, eight battle armored cars, more than 120 people killed and wounded
At the end of last week a large group of Ukrainian soldiers was surrounded by militias in the Ilovaisk area of Donetsk region.
Russian President Vladimir Putin asked the leadership of the "national republics" to release Ukrainian soldiers from the encirclement.
The DRC agreed to do so on the condition that the enemy surrender weapons and ammunition.
The first dozens of soldiers began leaving the surrounded settlements on Saturday morning.
According to the commander of the Ukrainian territorial defense battalion "Donbass" Semenchenko, another 14 people came out of the "catch" on Sunday night.

In his Facebook, Semenchenko wrote that Ukrainian wounded are "prisoned at 137 regiment of the 32nd Division of the Russian Federation and 9th Tank Brigade of the Russian Federation", where they are treated well.
Meanwhile, the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Defence denied reports by Ukrainian military and NATO about the presence of Russian units in Ukraine.
Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs: Russia will take countermeasures in case of new EU sanctions
Russia reserves the right to take countermeasures aimed at protecting its legitimate interests in the event of introduction of new anti-Russian sanctions, the Russian Foreign Ministry reports.

The statement of the Russian Foreign Ministry says that the "conclusions" of the European Council of 30 August demonstrated the inability of the EU member states to overcome the inertia of their unwavering support by the Kiev authorities.

Brussels continues to insist that Russia is involved in the situation in eastern Ukraine, relying on "absolutely unproven statements about the presence of Russian armed forces in the territory of that country", the agency's website said.

The Russian Foreign Ministry regrets that the European Council, contrary to the interests of its member states, is subject to the influence of countries that are interested in strengthening the confrontation with Russia.

The members of the European Council should call for a peaceful settlement of the conflict in eastern Ukraine, as well as provide the conditions for a full "dialogue between the opposing sides", the agency stresses.

Also on the website of the department it is noted that now there are no objective assessments of the humanitarian situation in Donbass, where a full-scale humanitarian disaster has returned, and the number of victims among the civilian population is increasing.
We remind that within the next seven days in the European Union it is planned to develop concrete proposals on sanctions against the Russian Federation.
At the same time, EU representatives work closely with US officials.
It is assumed that they will correlate between the measures to be taken over the period of action and the degree of severity.
The new EU sanctions could affect the energy and financial sectors.
The Australian government has also announced an expansion of sanctions against Russia in the areas of defense, finance, and the oil and gas industry.
Cheap ways to save on university textbooks
While the cost of university textbooks for many students exceeds $1,000 a year, Matt Schröder, who will soon move to a second course, has devised a tricky way to cut costs.
He developed a system for renting books to seniors, offering them nominal compensation to delay their sale.
"My mathematical analysis textbook, which usually costs $180, I got for a semester for $10 and a "Chick-fil-A" cookie," says Schröder, 19, who is studying at Covenant College in Georgia.
The required literature for the last semester would cost $430, he says.
He spent $120.
According to the College Council, the average student spends more than $1200 a year on textbooks and educational supplies, but students have a number of options to reduce these costs.
Students are increasingly choosing online shops and creative ideas such as the Schröder system.
Book rental is becoming increasingly popular, allowing students to use the book during the semester, and is often significantly cheaper than their purchase.
Nibo Inc., which owns more than 250 university bookstores, reports that book sales have doubled since 2011.
Industry research shows that about a quarter of the books in university bookstores during the last spring semester were rented out, says Nibo Vice President Trevor Meyer.
Less than half of all books are purchased in university bookstores, according to the professional association "National Association of University Bookstores".
Here is an introduction to the best ways to make a profitable deal.
Purchase in online shop
Sometimes, if you go online, the price of a new book can be one third of what you will see in a university bookshop.

The ninth edition of "Mathematical Analysis" by Ron Larson, Bruce Edwards, and Robert Hosteler costs about $290 per preview, but a new copy can be purchased for $239.99 at Chegg.com, which specializes in selling textbooks.
Purchase of maintenance
If you are not against foreign notices or damage, maintained textbooks are a good option.
Mathematical Analysis is sold for $93.49 on Chegg.com.

Matt Casey, 25, a fourth-year student at Brigham Young University, says he paid 42 cents on Amazon.com for a kept copy of the textbook "Strategic Solutions in Media: Understanding the Business Side of Advertising Business".
The book was sold for $48.

Teachers, such as Ingrid Brycey, director of the "College Without Walls" at the University of Massachusetts in Emherst, offers students to ask their professors if they can't use previous publications.
Sometimes updates are not essential for classes.
In such cases, old editions can often be found for a very small share of the value of the last edition.
In addition to Chegg and Amazon sites, Half.com, owned by eBay Inc., is a popular alternative to buying used books.
Rental
If you are good enough to deal with the textbooks, do not forget to return them and do not want to leave them to yourself after the course is over.
You can save more than 80% of the cost of a new book.
For example, one student could rent "Mathematical Analysis" for a semester for about $20.
Find out the rules of the store where you pick up the books, including any penalties that may be imposed on you for marking, highlighting and damage.
If you rent a book, remember: if you do not return the book, the fines may even exceed the cost of the new copy.
Electronic books
Electronic books instead of traditional textbooks - another option.
Sometimes such books are actually rented by buying an electronic license for a certain period from distributors such as Amazon.com, Chegg and Barnes & Noble Inc.
Renting Mathematical Analysis on Chegg.com for six months will cost about $61.

Breisy says that students studying literature often find the most profitable prices, as many classical works can now be downloaded for free, while literature in the natural and engineering sciences can be very expensive.
Nevertheless, be careful.

Joe Gold, 29 years old, who is going to start studying at Pepperdine Law School, recommends using the ISBN number to clarify the price of the book, as it guarantees that you are looking for exactly the text you need.
Before making an online order, says Holt, it is imperative to check whether the book is actually on stock.
This lesson was not easy for him.
The book he purchased was delayed for four weeks, and eventually he paid the full price at the university bookstore.

Why the Guardians of the Galaxy could not save the cash collections

"The Unstoppable 3" by Sylvester Stallone returned less than $30 million from its $90 million U.S. budget, while "City of Sins: A Woman worth Killing" returned only $12 million from its $70 million budget.
"The Big Video" with Cameron Diaz earned only $14.6 million in the first weekends, while children's films such as "How to Attach Dragon 2" also disappoint revenue.
The article by Telegraph film critic Robbie Collins points out that when it comes to children's films, it may be about the poor quality of the films themselves.
Collins called 2014 the "worst" year ever in terms of children's films, and called "How to Attach Dragon 2" a barely "functioning" fantasy sequel.
However, when it comes to films aimed at a slightly older audience, it seems that the problem is not necessarily the films themselves.

In July, Entertainment Weekly compared the average ratings of CinemaScore and Metacritic for each film released in the summer with at least 2,000 copies between Memorial Day in May and July 20, 2013 and this year.
The results, which take into account the opinion of both film viewers and film critics, suggest that this year's film crop is similar in calibre to last year's hits.
Some commentators suggest that this may be due to changing viewing habits and growing popularity of streaming Internet services such as Netflix.
Director John Favreau, who is currently working on the soon-to-be released Disney film The Jungle Book, told the Hollywood Reporter: "I think times are changing."
We must recognise this and not try to pursue what was before.
Unlike the current drop in Hollywood revenues, Netflix’s revenue from streaming reached $1.2 billion, almost double last year’s $837 million.
Last summer, director Steven Spielberg criticized the studios for relying too heavily on comic book franchises, and predicted Hollywood's "ghost."
In light of the current downturn, some commentators argue that his dark predictions were partly true.

With several potential box office hits expected in the summer of 2015, including "The Avengers: The Age of Altron", "Minions" and "South Park", other film industry representatives are more optimistic.

"People X" producer Simon Kinberg recently called the drop in box office revenues simply "cyclical", saying to the Hollywood Reporter: "The next summer will be the most box office summer in history, and no one will worry about it."

Many restaurants of European cuisine do not know what will happen to them when the stocks of cheese are finished
Photo: Alexander Miridonov, Kommersant
Cancellation menus
On August 6, President Vladimir Putin signed a decree on the application of certain economic measures to ensure Russia’s security, which are called mainly productive sanctions.
It is prohibited to import beef, pork, meat and domestic poultry products, meat delicacies, fish, dairy products, milk, yogurt, curd, cheese, vegetables, fruits, nuts, cabbages and sugar syrups.
Restaurant chains have begun to work with suppliers: prices for products have risen, it is urgent to look for similar products from other countries.

For example, in early 2014, Rosselkhoznadzor banned the import of Australian beef, and a year earlier - American and Canadian meat.
In exchange, the suppliers arranged the supply of beef from Argentina, Uruguay and New Zealand.
But the 2014 summer sanctions proved much more serious.

Italian Valerio hopes that the sanctions can be further relaxed.
So far, some restaurants exist in uncertain conditions.
According to East-West, one of the largest suppliers of HoReCa, the share of imported products in the premium segment was up to 70%.
"Decent restaurants will have to change their menus to the ones produced by local farmers and other countries," says Sergei Mironov, restaurant owner and Resconсалt agency owner.

"Brasserie bridge" is ready for this: you will have to give up 10-15% of meals, another half of the menu - rework.
In restaurants with mixed cuisine already start to replace dishes, such as steak from marble beef - to beefstrogans, says Sergei Mironov.
"Europe cheeses can be replaced with Russian, Belarusian cheeses, cheeses from Serbia, Argentina, Tunisia, Chile," says Oksana Glibchuk, a representative of East-West Company.
Molds and dairy products from Europe have similar products in Russia and Belarus.
Chicken from the USA can be replaced with chicken from Russia and Belarus, salmon and sage from Norway - salmon, sage, trout from Belarus and Chile.
The absence of vegetables and fruits of European production can be compensated by the products of domestic producers, offers from Serbia, Moldova and China.
According to Mironov, budget network restaurants will be easier to restructure than the premium segment: it is unlikely that there were gourmets able to distinguish Italian mozzarella from Russian.
Although it will be difficult for Ginza Project institutions, he believes.
Ginza Project has several dozen restaurants with different brands and menus.
The replacement will take a lot of time," Mironov says.
Ginza refused to comment, citing the absence of owners in the country.

From the CIS it is cheaper to get cuts, lambs, tomatoes, cucumbers, fruits.
At the same time, what is imported from Central Asia is much better than "plastics" from Italy, Spain and Turkey.
Everybody knows that Uzbek tomatoes are delicious and sweet.
No one speaks that way about Spanish.

Belarus and Kazakhstan announced their intention to replace European imports to Russia almost immediately after the introduction of sanctions.

And you will not hold our Far Eastern salmon in your hands.
Only institutions without special claims agree to replace Italian mozzarella domestic
In the window of his tent there are shrimp with tag "Magdan", fries, omul, mucus, midies from Crimea, shrimp from the Far East.
Galkin is convinced that it is long overdue to switch to fishing from the Far East.
According to statistics, fish catches in Russia in 2013 - more than 4 million tons, much of the fish goes to Japan, Korea and even to the United States.
Imports of fish in 2013 - about 800 thousand tons.

Lavka "Your People" has been operating since 2012, selling fish through an online shop, before the introduction of the sanctions served another one and a half dozen restaurants, such as "Simplified things".
Currently, 15 more restaurants have submitted applications to the Gallery.
The same soil can be made of our fish, - it heats up.
We were frozen, tried different recipes.
Now we sell dried fruit through the online shop for a million rubles per month.
Our fish is several times cheaper, and shipping - it is a maximum of 15 rubles per kilogram.
In confirmation in the Galkin shuttle I prepare a portion of "Philippines" with ketchup.
Unlike rollers with sage, these have to hunt longer, but the awareness that this fish is ours, domestic, adds strength.
On the site of the shop "Your People" there are even rolls of pallet and sea oak.
In sushi bars, however, the Norwegian salmon is preferred to Chilean salmon.
Galkin explains this by the fact that chefs are lazy to come up with new recipes with Far Eastern fish.
"Russian fish suppliers have not offered us yet", - explains owner of Killfish Bar Dmitry Evseev.
The same situation applies to other products: Russian producers could take over the liberated niche, but this does not happen.

According to Boris Akimov, founder and co-owner of the LavkaLavka project, it is now possible to talk more about replacing imports from Europe and America with imports from China, Israel and Latin America.
There are large transnational corporations with powerful logistics and large volumes.
They are able to quickly replace banned imports, unlike our farmers.
That is, large producers of other countries will benefit from the ban," Akimov says.
Last month, however, the restaurant industry received a more alarming signal than the food sanctions.

Following the results of mass unscheduled inspections of Rosneprnadzor, the activities of three McDonald's enterprises in Moscow and two regional enterprises in Stavropol and Yekaterinburg were temporarily suspended.
"We are studying the essence of the claims filed to determine the actions necessary for the immediate opening of restaurants for visitors," - said "Denгам" in the McDonald's press service.
In fact, no one understands what will happen next.
If everything is restricted to product sanctions, it is one option that can survive, - says the employee of the restaurant consulting company on the condition of anonymity.
But if McDonald's starts to close across the country, the scenario will be completely different.
"Europrotokol" instead of the traffic police directory
Cash payments can be received without the guidance of the traffic police - so the Central Bank intends to stimulate the introduction in Russia of "Europrotocol".

The Bank of Russia has developed a draft instructions according to which from September 1 of this year, in order to receive cash payments for the insured car driver will be able to do without the assistance of the traffic police.
It is true that this is only the case when the accident was registered on the "Europrotocol" without the involvement of the road police.

That is, if there were only two cars involved in the accident, there were no physically injured persons, the damage did not exceed the limit and both drivers reached agreement on who was responsible for the accident.

From August 2, the limit of payments for Europrotocol is 50 thousand rubles, and from October 1, in Moscow, St. Petersburg, as well as in Moscow and Leningrad regions it will be increased to 400 thousand rubles.
The point is that often, even with minor damages, in situations where an accident can be registered by "Europrotocol", drivers, caught in an accident, call the police.
After all, it was not possible to get compensation for it without the assistance of the traffic police in the presence of a cash register.
The parameters specified in the draft guidelines are intended to remove this obstacle on the way to the introduction of the "Europrotocol" in Russia.
According to them, the maximum cash payment in connection with traffic accidents, issued without the police officers, should not be lower than the limit on "Europrotocol".
At the same time, however, it cannot be higher than the limit specified in the insurance contract.
The idea is certainly useful and theoretically able to unload both the staff of the DFS and the roads.
But it is likely that neither car makers nor insurers will be delighted by it.
The latter already speak of a serious threat to the growth of fraud, which could result from the introduction of new rules on cash payments.
As for the drivers, it is difficult to imagine what work will have to be done to overcome the original Russian conservatism.
In most cases, the driver will wait for hours for the inspector to make a small accident, because it is more reliable.
And it is not yet known what will be easier - to defeat fraudsters or convince drivers in the reliability of "Europrotokol".
The Saving Certificate will make it unique and irrevocable
The Ministry of Finance wants to ban savings certificates on depositors, but will allow banks to make them an analogue of a non-refundable deposit.
The Ministry of Finance is preparing a bill that will prohibit savings certificates on the applicant.
Recently, this tool is gaining popularity, as the rates here are higher than on bank deposits.

The fact is that savings certificates for the depositor do not fall into the deposit insurance system, and they are cheaper for the bank as there is no need to make deductions to the fund of the Deposit Insurance Agency (DBA).

The pity of the situation is that this step is planned to be taken because of small and medium-sized banks distributing such certificates, and the Sberbank and Bank of Moscow will suffer from it, which, according to ASV estimates, control 98% of the profile market.
And the share of the Bank of Moscow, according to the agency estimates, is about 3.5%.
The problem, the ASV explains, is that customers of a small bank, who bought such a certificate, in case of withdrawal of the license from it try to get money in the ASV.
Some investors, who do not have sufficient financial literacy and purchase savings certificates from a predecessor, may assume that their investments are insured.
Reasonable absence of insurance payments on these certificates in case of withdrawal of the license from the bank can lead to misunderstanding and social tension.
In the practice of the agency there were cases where holders of certificates of presentation tried to seek insurance compensation through the court," the ASV said.
The problem is, of course, deliberate.
After all, nobody will pay the buyers of certificates anyway, because they do not have the right to compensation from the state by law.

If it were the case that the instrument is not insured in ASV, together with it would be banned metal accounts, on which citizens' funds are taken into account in grams of one of the four metals - gold, silver, platinum and palladium.
After all, these accounts also do not fall into the deposit insurance system, but for their existence until now no one attempts.
The fact is that certificates on the forwarder are a very convenient securities, which can actually act as quasi-denominations.
Their movement is virtually uncontrolled: any bank customer can buy a certificate, pass it on to any citizen, and many owners can change the certificate before it is cashed out.
It is no coincidence that the bill stipulates that a savings certificate must be a specific securities that must be stored in a depository.
And to send the pill to the banks, such certificates are allowed to be issued without the right of early repayment.
That is, an analogue of a non-refundable deposit that bankers have long dreamed of is introduced.

Germany to send 30 anti-tank complexes to Iraq

Germany will supply weapons to Iraq to counter terrorists from the Islamic State group, ITAR-TASS reported on August 31 with reference to the decision taken following the meeting of representatives of the German government headed by Chancellor Angela Merkel.
According to reports, Germany will send to Iraq 30 portable anti-tank missile complexes "Milan" and 500 charges to them, as well as 8,000 G3 and G36 assault rifles.
The shipments will be carried out by the end of September.
In addition, it was decided to allocate another 50 million euros to Iraq for humanitarian aid.
On September 1, Mrs Merkel will address the Bundestag with a government statement on the subject.
So far Germany has not delivered its weapons to "hot spots".
The Germans disagreed about sending weapons to the Iraqis.
Some believe that this is the only way to stop fighters from the "Islamic State", others fear that this weapon may end up in the hands of terrorists.
Soldiers killed Ukrainian patrol boat in the Azov Sea
Donetsk militia attacked a Ukrainian patrol boat in the Azov Sea, ITAR-TASS reported on August 31.
According to the available data, this occurred in the Taganrog Bay near settlements Широкino and Bezыменное (10-20 km east of Mariupol).
A number of Ukrainian media reports about the shooting of two shore guard boats.

Teenagers were taken by helicopter from Blue Mountains
Two bushucker teenagers were transported by helicopter to a safe place after spending the night stuck in the Blue Mountains of New South Wales.
A 16-year-old girl and an 18-year-old young man set out on a hike shortly after midday on Sunday at the Hovetts Lip in Blackhite.
Concerned relatives called the police around 8 p.m. when they did not return home.
A search team, including local police and a rescue team, was dispatched and the couple were found around 11pm near the Braidal Way Falls.
The girl injured her knee, and the young man fell and broke his head.
The officers stayed with the couple for the night, and they were picked up on the bench on Monday morning.
They were taken by a stable ambulance to the Blue Mountains Hospital.
Two alliances met

The negotiations at the highest level in Minsk did not solve the problems for which they were called, but created a new format: the first persons of the European Union met with the first persons of the future of Eurasian
For the first time, the leaders of the EU and the Customs Union discussed a number of “hot issues” despite the disturbing situation (the situation around Ukraine is not tolerated).
Whether such a structure is capable of functioning effectively is unclear; however, it is clear who took the sleeves off this summit.
On the evening of 26 August, Belarusians, followed by other Eurasians and Europeans, saw the new President Lukashenko on TV news.
The Belarusian leader gave an example of careful politeness, it was the behavior of a man who has just broken a jackpot - and plans a decent old age in the upper society.
How Maidan Lukashenko helped

The arrival in Minsk of the three main European Commissioners (EU ministers), who met with Lukashenko and allowed him to speak at the final briefing on their behalf, is not just the legitimacy of the president with 20 years of experience.
It is a declaration to recognise Minsk as a full-fledged subject of European policy and the main mediator of the Ukrainian crisis.
Senior analyst of the Belarusian Institute of Strategic Studies Denis Melyantsov is sure that Brussels will no longer be able to talk to Minsk in the same tone as before.
"The fact that Catherine Ashton met with Lukashenko one by one gives grounds to believe that relations with the EU will continue to be discussed," he told "Ognika".
This iceberg has a hidden part: preparations for the breakdown of the Belarusian authorities began long before the November Maidan in Kiev - in the summer of 2013.

"Results have been achieved and with the EU - it is successful negotiations on visa regime simplification and re-admission, dialogues on modernization, - the interlocutor "Ogonka" lists, - and negotiations on international security were held with the US.
The states even lifted a few sanctions.
As far as the Ukrainian events are concerned, they themselves and the reaction of the Belarusian leadership to them have only undermined this process.
Minsk, on the one hand, managed to maintain relations with Ukraine - warm enough not to lose much in mutual trade, and President Poroshenko could come to Belarus for negotiations.

On the other hand, the Belarusian leader, who de jure did not recognize the annexation of Crimea to Russia and urged to punish the pro-Russian militias in Donbass with all severity, did not argue with Moscow either.
Minsk has not left either the Customs Union or the CSTO, and a Russian airbase is located in Baranovichy.
Brussels and Washington noted Minsk's balanced position on the Ukrainian issue - and appreciated it, Belarusian experts are sure.
The success of Lukashenko’s move towards political diversification will be seen by how often Minsk will be able to hold meetings in the EU+TS format in the near future.

The press service of the EU High Representative for Foreign Policy and Diplomacy Catherine Ashton was unable to respond promptly to questions about what Brussels expects from relations in the new format.
Ashton's press secretary Maya Kosyanchich only told "Ogonka" that this issue is not a priority in the light of the resolution of war and peace issues.
At the same time there were reports that Kazakhstan could become the next meeting place on the Ukrainian issue with the participation of the first persons in the new format.
President Nursultan Nazarbayev’s statement, in which he admitted that he was personally asked to do so by representatives of the European Union, was the key to Minsk.

At the final briefing, however, Alexander Lukashenko made it clear that all sides are not against Minsk remaining the central venue for meetings in the Russia-ECB-Ukraine format, as well as at the level of Heads of State and High Representatives of the European Commission.
This means that the “last dictator of Europe” will gain the status of a fully committed European leader, helping to solve the global problem.
The best friend of the European farmer

Already the composition of the EU delegation, which included the European Commissioners for Trade and Energy, pointed to the conclusion: the main background of the summit is not the tragic situation in Donbass, but the economy.

In fact, the schedule of future negotiations on gas supplies and overcoming the concerns of the CIS countries regarding Ukraine’s association with the EU appears to be a larger achievement than peaceful declarations without specific dates and figures.
Trade Commissioner Karl De Gucht, however, noted: EU representatives "have come to Minsk to seek a solution to the political crisis, which has economic consequences, and not vice versa".
It seems, however, that the economic crisis in Ukraine also "works" on Belarus.
Its consequences – and, above all, the mutual sanctions between the West and Russia – give Minsk, which itself is under sanctions pressure, a long-awaited field of maneuver.

According to the head of the Science and Research Center of Mises, former candidate for President of Belarus Yaroslav Romanchuk, European investors are actively interested in Belarus’ possibilities for supplying agricultural products to the Russian Federation to circumvent sanctions.
At the same time, supply schemes are being put forward, for which Vladimir Putin at the summit burned Minsk.
“The initiators of these schemes are not Belarusian businessmen, but Russian companies,” Romanchuk said.
They have long worked out schemes of supply of goods, including from Poland, Germany, Lithuania, and today these schemes are destroyed.
Russian business urgently needs to somehow restore them, even through the mediation of Belarusian structures.

The second story, the expert continues, is related to the fact that many Ukrainian companies cannot help but set up production in Belarus from Ukrainian raw materials also with orientation to the Russian market.
Ukrainian producers export about 4 billion dollars to Russia, and Belarusian production and trade schemes can now prove very in demand."

According to Romanchuk, the role of the host of the platform for negotiations between the EU and the CIS is ideal for Lukashenko and from the point of view of the development of economic ties with Europe.

He recalls that the losses of the EU agricultural sector from Moscow sanctions are estimated at 5-10 billion euros, and the European Commission has currently offered only 125 million euros compensation to farmers.
The Belarusian president can offer Brussels to work together to minimize the consequences for euro farmers.
This could raise Lukashenko’s credibility in the EU to unprecedented heights.
Hospitality without initiative
Catherine Ashton thanked the Belarusian authorities for the initiative to hold the summit.

But the paradox is that the official Minsk is being disconnected from its active role in the birth of the ТС+EU format, and the Belarusian leader at a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart stressed that Kiev was the initiator of the new format.

"It was your proposal to gather, without any hesitation to discuss, not from the bay to take a decision, after signing the Association Treaty with the EU, to understand the situation that was at that moment in Ukraine," he addressed in front of the cameras to Petro Poroshenko.
However, observers interpreted this as an attempt to calm Moscow, which was originally reportedly opposed to Minsk’s mediation, which greatly increases its political weight.

In the Belarusian diplomatic office, it is emphasized that Belarus does not pursue crude goals when organizing cooperation between the EU and the CIS on its land, but the ultimate goal of such a format is the creation of a single economic space from Lisbon to Vladivostok in the future.

"This is absolutely in the spirit of the concepts that in other spheres, in particular in the security sphere, promotes and promotes the leadership of our strategic ally - the Russian Federation," - said Ogonka in the Belarusian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, a department where recently the words are carefully selected.

Greco-Roman squirrel
The film by Frank Miller and Robert Rodriguez "City of Sins-2: A Woman Who Should Be Killed" did not bring about the revolution that could have been expected of it.
The first "City of Sins" (2005), shot with the minimal but symbolic participation of Quintino Tarantino, revolutionized the relationship between film, comics and literary noir.

Sequel is also revolutionary in its own way: in the sense that it breaks down the fundamental chain of modern thinking "thesis - antithesis - synthesis" (if you understand under the thesis the universe of zero, and under thesis the cosmos of comics).
From now on it should read: "thesis - antithesis - chaos".
"City of Sins-2" is chaotic both on the dramatic and on the philosophical level: both times it is chaotic in the stupid sense of the word.

Yes, some of the heroes are familiar from the first "City", although, here, Marv (Micky Rurk), remembered, ended life on an electric chair, and here, nothing, only manages to catch - in the role of this popular wives - from the air knives and other tops with pushers.

But the old people are literally shaken by the elbows of the newcomers, as if they had slipped into the city from some other film, about the meaning and the plot of which the viewers are asked not to worry.
So, his own story, shamelessly interrupted by the authors in the most interesting place, at the super-successful player Johnny (Joseph Gordon-Levitt).
Hers is with the greedy frigid Eva Lord (Eva Green) and for something moving to her Duet (Josh Brolin).

But this confusion, in which Dwight, let's say, face is not distinguished from Johnny - all the more so that faces, like other parts of the body, are borne by characters with unbelievable regularity, - not misery and even not victory.
These are not people, but we understand that these are the archetypes of Nuar: rocky suck, too self-confident player, satisfied in the "metal trap" of sex detective, corrupt whistle-blower senator.
Well, and when the archetype wrestles with the archetype and the archetype drives, it is no longer a film, but rather an abstract painting.
And to ask abstract painting questions about the logic of the plot is simply funny.
Moreover, even in this turbulent world there is something permanent.
The battleships from the first "City" still hold round defense from the occupying their native slums forces of darkness.
And the ghost of detective Hartigan is not-no, and he will look at the fence, and Bruce Willis is always pleasant to look at.
The main problem of the City of Sins-2 is another.
Frank Miller was good in that as a painter talentedly combined comics and noir, and as a director - turned the idea of how to bring comics to the screen.
Comics and Noir are two aggressively opposite "realities".

The phenomenon of comics in its modern form was born in the late 1920s, when the novels of Dashel Hammet "The Bloody Harvest" (1929), "The Maltese Falcon" (1930) and "The Glass Key" (1931) created the canon of Nuar, then hard-boiled school - "the red school".
Well or pulp fiction.

The comics gave Hollywood many dozens of heroes: from the sailor Poppy - the hunter of the spider giving him rich power, Superman, Batman and the spy Dick Tracy to Hulk, Thor, Spider-Man and other " Avengers".
But in any comic film there was something damaged: the drawn characters persistently did not want to turn into screen clowns, remained pretenders in their surrounding "real" world.
In short, they were completely deprived of "existence".
Noir, on the contrary, is the most existential genre of world literature.
After the world wars, the traditional novel - with its experiences, characteristics, family scandals and historical background - lost all credibility.
What Forsyths, what Tibo and Rugon Mackaras, what even Bolconsk and Rostov are thought of after Verden, Auschwitz and Hiroshima?
Such a novel peacefully mutated into the format of a soap opera, and criminal - i.e. by definition marginal - novel rose to the level of philosophical praise.
Hammet learned what it was like to work as a sanitary worker on the front.
He was a communist.
As, by the way, were at least close to the Communist Party and such genre pillars as writers Horace McCoy and Jim Thompson, directors Jules Dassen, Joseph Loузи, Edward Dmitryk.
Therefore, the animal, whose archetype they proposed, on the one hand, is crude and cynical, and on the other - totally social.
It is almost an American version of social realism.
The first "City of Sins" was remarkable precisely because it unnaturally but organically combined the comic with theнуар.
For the first time on the screen the comics lived, no shyness of its graphic nature, rather than pretending to be a "real" movie.
The darkness of the sales world, where the cardinal ordered murders and the senator covered the monstrous son-садista, was quite worthy of Hammet's pen.

And picturesque details like cut heads, with which the gardener decorated his nest, the pen of the genius James Ellroy, the author of "Black Orchid" and the best - i.e., declaratively smelly - representative of neonurture.
"City of Sins-2" is not even a retreat, but a capitulation to Miller-Rodriguez's radical style before the comic tradition.
Probably, in large part, this happened because of 3D technologies.
When you look at the second "City of Sins", you feel trapped in a glass ball in which snow melts a toy cloak.
However, most often it is not snow, but bloody scars, but on the whole what is the difference?
There is nothing to say about sociality.

After all, it is possible only when somewhere, somewhere in our country sometimes, even on the other side of a dirty marsh, but there is a normal world, where you can return a girl who walked along a curved road or, say, tell unsuspecting parents that her loser is punished.
But when there is no place for sin in the city except for sin, then sin is no longer sin, but the norm.
Delicious, like any norm.
The chaos of "City of Sins-2" is simply silent.
For the sake of justice, the domestic rent has given this press sin a small, but pearl.
The titles warn: the film contains harmful scenes of smoking.
With regard to the spectacle, in the very vegetarian episode where a man's fingers are broken by shields, it gives hell humor.
Hammett would like it.
France's Socialists must "get together and put France in order," says the key ally of François Hollande
Mr. Wall called on the deeply divided left to "show warm affection" for the attacked Socialist President, whose changes did not find the approval of the overwhelming majority of French.
The President deserves the respect of everyone, he deserves our loyalty, he deserves our support.
"It is our duty to stay close to him," he said, applauding.

As a gesture of reconciliation, the prime minister assured that his government would not question the controversial 35-hour week in France, despite fiercely conflicting proposals, it should weaken the rules made by Emmanuel Macron, the new economy minister, earlier this week.
On Saturday, Mr. Holland prayed to his Socialist Party colleagues to remain "unified" with the government.

However, Christian Tober, Minister of Justice, put the sticks in the wheels when he came to the Socialist Party's unanimous parliamentary assembly and criticized the Socialist Party for allowing the French "to lose faith in the future".

Marine Le Pe, leader of the far-right National Front, condemned the continuing internal conflicts among socialists, saying she did not think that Wallis' new government would last longer than a few months.
François Hollande is a naked king, but a naked and Prince Manuel Vall, forced to form a new government when the previous one did not last the summer.
"And the new one won't last autumn or winter either," Mrs. Le Pen told reporters.
She reiterated her party's call for the parliament to be dissolved, saying that she was confident the party could easily win early elections and was ready to govern.
The French ruling party suffered a defeat in the March municipal elections, and the far-right National Front came first in the May EU elections.

A survey by Sunday’s Journal du Dimanche found that 76 percent of French believe that the Socialist Party risks splitting into several rival factions before the end of Mr. Hollande’s presidency in 2017.

Otherwise, the situation could get even worse.
"City without drugs" remained without a claim
The Sverdlovsk Arbitration Court dismissed the appeal of the Administrative Directorate of the Regional Ministry for Housing Management to the "City Without Drugs" Fund.
The agency intended to collect from the organization more than 7 million rubles as a rent for the building in the center of Yekaterinburg.
However, the defendant did not appear in court twice.

Today the Arbitration Court of Sverdlovsk Oblast left without consideration the application of the Executive Directorate of the Ministry for the Management of State Property of the Region (MUGISO) to the "City without Drugs" Foundation (one of the founders - Yekaterinburg Mayor Yevgeny Royzman).
Representatives of the regional authorities intended to collect from the organization 7.3 million rubles as a rent for the building.
Today it became known that the plaintiff did not appear twice in court, which is why the decision on refusal of consideration was taken.
The reason of the absence of representatives in the management of MUGISO could not be explained, the head of the legal department Maxim Titov did not answer the telephone calls.
The representatives of the foundation also failed to contact.
Recall, it is about the mansion, which occupied the fund in the center of the city on Belinsky Street, 19 on a free basis since 2011.
This decision was made by former Governor Alexander Misharin.

In November 2012, the administrative department of the Ministry of State Property Management of Sverdlovsk Oblast filed a lawsuit against the Sverdlovsk Arbitration Court for the removal of the fund from the building.
According to the appeal, the department demanded through the court to recognize the unencumbered contract of free use of the premises of the memorial mansion.
According to the management of MUGISO, the agreement did not contain substantial conditions for leasing the cultural heritage object.
The Sverdlovsk arbitration court rejected the suit, then an appeal was lodged in the 17th Perry arbitration court, which was satisfied.

Then in the same court the fund filed a cassation complaint on this decision, which remained unsatisfactory, after which the decision was appealed by the fund in the High Court of Arbitration, but the court took the side of the Directorate.
In 2013, a new lease agreement was concluded, under which the fund again began to pay rent, the head of the city Evgeny Royzman told about it.
The rent was set at 300 thousand rubles per month.
The previous administration of the region handed over this building to us for free use, recognizing our merits in the fight against drugs, in recognition of the Foundation.
The current administration has decided differently,” he said.
Tatiana Drogaeva, Yekaterinburg

iPhone will turn into a wallet
In the run-up to September 9, when Apple is due to present its new developments, there are all new leaks in the press about what can be expected from the presentation.
The sixth generation of iPhone will be equipped with mobile wallet function as a result of a joint project of Apple and the payment systems Visa, MasterCard and American Express.

According to Bloomberg and specialized website Re/code, at the presentation of new products September 9, Apple can announce, among other things, a joint project with Visa, MasterCard and American Express, as a result of which the new smartphone iPhone 6 will be available mobile wallet function.
The companies themselves refuse to comment on this.
This feature allows you to make a payment at the store cashier with the help of a smartphone.
Payment identification will be performed by the user on his fingerprint using the Touch ID function.

It is reported that the iPhone will be the first to integrate NFC (near field communication) technology, which allows to make contactless payment using a smartphone and corresponding reading device at the cashier.
NFC technology itself will be available thanks to a special microprocessor from the Dutch high-tech company NXP (formerly Philips Semiconductors).

The NFC feature was first introduced in 2004 as part of the collaboration of Sony, Nokia, Philips Semiconductors and more than a hundred other companies that joined the so-called NFC Forum - an association to promote this technology.
The first NFC phone was released by Nokia in 2006.
The first Android smartphone with NFC functionality - Samsung Nexus S - was introduced in 2010.
In May 2011, Google introduced the Google Wallet system, allowing users to attach bank cards to their Google account and pay using a smartphone on Android.

However, U.S. experts stress that despite high-tech companies’ large investments in promoting NFC technology, U.S. retailers are still cautious about innovation and are not too willing to spend money on their store equipment with such systems.
So now observers hope that Apple’s entry into this market will still make retailers accelerate and more actively implement this technology in their outlets.

Norwegian Cruise approaches $3-million deal with Prestige Cruises

Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd NCHL.O, the third largest cruise operator in the world, is in the final stages of negotiations to acquire a similar company Prestige Cruises International Inc for approximately $3 billion, according to people familiar with the situation.

The deal would provide Norwegian Cruise, a company with a market value of $6.8 billion, access to luxury cruise ships and supplies to Prestige Cruises customers, as it competes with larger rivals Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd (RCL.N) and Carnival Corp (CCL.N).
The agreement could be announced as early as this week, sources said Sunday, warning that negotiations could still fail.
The owner of Prestige Cruises, the private investment company Apollo Global Management LLC (APO.N), also owns 20 percent of Norwegian Cruise.
Sources have asked to remain anonymous, as the negotiations are not open.
Representatives of Norwegian Cruise and Prestige Cruises did not respond to the request to comment, while the representative of Apollo refused to comment on the information.
Norwegian Cruise, based in Miami, operates 13 cruise ships on routes covering North America, the Mediterranean, the Baltic Sea, Central America and the Caribbean.
Its income amounted to $2.57 billion in 2013, 13 percent more than in 2012.

Prestige Cruises, also based in Miami, operates under the brands Oceania and Regent, which together own eight cruise ships that go to Scandinavia, Russia, the Mediterranean, North America, Asia, Africa and South America.
It reported revenues of $1.2 billion in 2013, 6 percent higher than a year earlier.
The $29 billion cruise industry is expected to benefit from the growth of the middle class in emerging economies such as China and India in the years to come.
Companies in the race seek to position themselves as cruise operators preferred by these new customers.
Prestige Cruises was registered with the U.S. regulatory authority for the initial public offering of shares in January 2014.
Apollo became the company's main shareholder after a $850 million deal in 2007.

Norwegian Cruise was created as it exists today, in 2000 as a result of a merger with a cruise operator owned by Genting Bhd (GENT.KL), a entertainment and casino conglomerate controlled by Malaysian billionaire Lim Kok Tai.
Apollo invested $1 billion in Norwegian Cruise in 2008.
Norwegian Cruise became a public company in January 2013.
Genting owns a 28 percent stake, Apollo owns a 20 percent stake, and TPG Capital LP owns an 8 percent stake in the company, as of the end of June, according to reports.

Carnival, Royal Caribbean Cruises and Norwegian Cruise together account for 82 percent of cruise passenger traffic in North America, according to registration documents at the first public offering of shares of Prestige Cruises.

Hong Kong Democratic Movement activists delay Chinese representative’s speech the following day after the election decision

Putin demands Kiev to start negotiations on "statehood" of eastern Ukraine

According to Russian news reports about his remarks, Russian President Vladimir Putin demanded on Sunday that the Ukrainian government stop fighting separatists in the east of the country and immediately start negotiations on the "statehood" of the divided region.

His press secretary, Dmitry Peskov, later clarified that Putin did not mean to suggest that Eastern Ukraine territory under separatist control would become part of Russia, but that its status within Ukraine should be reconsidered in order to give the Russian-speaking region the opportunity to defend its rights and interests.

But Putin’s call to the Kiev government to start negotiations with the pro-Russian rebels as equals was in line with the obvious strategy he has followed since the bloodshed began five months ago: Help the separatists take the territory and force the Ukrainian government to give the newly proclaimed territory of New Russia real independence in order to come closer to Russia, not the West.

In an interview with the state's First TV channel, Putin condemned the Ukrainian military campaign for the return of separatist-held territory in the eastern Donetsk and Lugansk regions, which were captured in March and April after Moscow annexed the Ukrainian peninsula of Crimea on March 18.
The Kremlin and separatists have recently named the occupied territories New Russia, or New Russia, a name that refers to the pre-revolutionary days of glory of the Russian Empire.

Putin said that anyone who believes that peaceful negotiations will take place in the near future, when Ukrainian politicians start campaigns for the 26 October parliamentary elections and while government troops attack peaceful settlements in regions held by separatists, is a "prisoner of illusions", ITAR-TASS reported.

"We must immediately start meaningful negotiations, not only on technical issues, but also on the political structure of society and state status of south-eastern Ukraine, in order to respect the interests of the people living there," he said.

Peskov said Putin's words about statehood were in the context of broader autonomy, which was discussed during months with leaders in Kiev in an attempt to calm fears in Russian-speaking regions that their cultural and linguistic rights were in danger.
Only the Ukrainian government can give the eastern regions the necessary autonomy, Peskov said.
It is not a question for discussion between Ukraine and Russia, Peskov said, "because it is not a conflict between Russia and Ukraine, but an internal Ukrainian conflict."

The intervention of the Kremlin's press secretary to correct Putin's "false interpretation" of the words underscored the Russian leadership's decision to treat the separatist uprising in the east in a different way than the open seizure of Crimea, where the majority of the 2 million people are ethnic Russians.

Moscow would have to endure a much more difficult battle to join even the Donetsk and Lugansk regions of eastern Ukraine, as most of the 6.5 million inhabitants are not Russians, and polls prior to the conflict showed broad support for the desire to remain inside Ukraine.

The autonomy that Russian diplomats discussed in international forums would give regional governments in Ukraine the power to determine trade agreements and foreign policy themselves, in fact, transferring to the Kremlin actual control over territory that would connect Russia’s main territory with Crimea.
The Black Sea Peninsula, joined five months ago, is home to the main Russian military fleet, as well as commercial maritime institutions and historical maritime resorts.
In the regions between the Russian Rostov region and Crimea there are also mines, factories and iron works that produce the necessary equipment for the Russian army.

Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko proposed during his inauguration speech on 7 June that Ukrainian legislators after the new elections should weigh constitutional amendments allowing to give the separated regions greater control over their finances and the status of languages.
However, his view of autonomy seems to be very different from that of the Kremlin and separatist insurgents, accused of arming and instigating Moscow.

Putin’s latest call to Kiev to negotiate with separatist leaders as equals followed renewed rebel attacks last week after Russian troops and tanks entered eastern Ukraine from a previously peaceful area along the Azov Sea.

Supported by Russia, the separatists took control of the city of Novoazovsk in an attack, which Ukrainian security officials say they fear is the beginning of a campaign to seize strategic coastal territory to the Crimea itself.

This resulted in large-scale civil and military efforts to strengthen Mariupol, a steel port with 500,000 inhabitants, which is located between Novoazovsky and a narrow passage to the Crimean Peninsula.

Poroshenko addressed a meeting of European Union leaders in Brussels on Saturday to call for measures to prevent further Russian aggression against Ukraine, the former Soviet republic, which has been independent for 23 years.
"We are approaching the point of irreversible," Poroshenko warned.
Thousands of foreign military and hundreds of foreign tanks are now on the territory of Ukraine.
The EU summit did not take certain measures; leaders called for a draft of tougher sanctions against Russia that would be adopted in the event of any escalation of the Ukrainian crisis.

Ukrainian soldiers had to leave their positions in Ilovaysk after two columns of Russian armored vehicles and 1,000 soldiers entered Donetsk region last week to support separatists experiencing difficulties, Colonel Andrey Lysenko, the press secretary of the National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine told reporters in Kiev on Saturday.

The first of 63 Ukrainian soldiers who are reportedly detained in Ilovaysk as a result of the Russian invasion were exchanged on Sunday for 10 Russian airborne pilots captured on Ukrainian territory a week ago, Lysenko said on Sunday.

Potential way of stealing photos of naked celebrities discovered
The massive hacking of star accounts may have been caused by a vulnerability in the Find My Phone app.
The potential development scenario was described by The Next Web.
A Python script was published on Github that allowed users to choose passwords for Apple's Find My Phone service.
This service allows you to track the location of the iPhone.
To access it, the same Apple ID and login connection is used as for accessing the Apple iCloud cloud from which celebrity photos were stolen.
The script allows you to retrieve passwords from Find My Phone.
In this method, all possible combinations of characters are entered sequentially, starting with the most frequently used passwords.
The author of the script claimed that in the service Find My Phone the number of password options to be entered is unlimited.
If the security system is properly organized after several failed attempts to enter the wrong password, the account must be blocked and notified to the user of the attempted breach.
Due to the vulnerability, users did not receive any messages about attempting to find a password for their account.
Hackers learned the password from Apple ID and used it to access iCloud.
According to a Twitter message from Hackapp user, the vulnerability was detected two days ago, on Saturday, and to it written a scripting program for password retrieval.
The vulnerability is currently closed: after five attempts, access to the service is blocked.

The source contacted the Hackapp user and he noted that the above-mentioned vulnerability is characteristic of many services, however he noted that there is no evidence that such a vulnerability was used to access the Star account.

Anger turned out to be the most universal and functional emotion of man

The serious expression of the face is biologically universal for mankind, and everyone involved in its creation organ and muscle group is not accidental, but is an additional means of expression of power and threat, scientists from Australia and the United States found.
Their discoveries were reported in Evolution and Human Behavior magazine, and can be read briefly in the press release of the University of California, Santa Barbara.

The angry expression of the face - bent and lowered cheeks, stretched into a thin line of lips, distorted nostrils - is the same in all cultures, and makes it even blind from birth children who have never seen it, says lead author of the study Aaron Sell.
Within the framework of a major research project devoted to the nature of anger, scientists discovered that this emotion has arisen for effective dispute resolution during conflict.
The more physical damage one person can cause to another, the more he has the ability to dictate his conditions, and he brings it to the interlocutor with the help of anger.

The researchers found confirmations of another hypothesis: physically strong people are more likely to be angry and switch to manuals, consider themselves entitled to impose unfavourable conditions on others, and prefer violent methods of peaceful conflict resolution.

Reflecting on the fact that anger is primarily a "trading emotion," the scientists decided that the movements of each of the seven muscle groups that create the angry expression of the face should make the angry individual more powerful and dangerous in the eyes of the interlocutor - and thus force him to agree with his conditions as soon as possible in order to avoid conflict.
To test this hypothesis, researchers modeled the face on a computer, where each of the seven elements of the angry face existed or lacked, and showed them to informants.
Although the lowered cheeks or forward raised chins alone did not make the face evil, the person depicted with such features was more physically strong, the researchers unanimously acknowledged.
Human anger, like animal anger, expresses a threat: an exaggerated manifestation of one’s own power, forcing one to agree and submit.
A man blows his nostrils and presses his lips with the same purpose as a frog that blows, or a grandmother that shows off her tail.

"The anger "is triggered" by the interlocutor's refusal to accept the situation, and the person immediately takes the form, most effectively demonstrating to the opposite side the consequences of this refusal.
But the most striking thing is that none of the components of the angry face is arbitrary, they all express the same,” said anthropologist John Tubi.
Ministry of Communications proposed to allocate 250 million rubles to "Crimea" TV and Radio Company
The Ministry of Communications proposed to allocate 250 million rubles from the federal budget to the autonomous non-profit organization "Television Company "Crimea" in 2014.
This is stated in the draft decision of the government, prepared by the agency, which was familiarized with "Leнта.ru".

According to the explanatory note to the project, subsidies from the federal budget will be directed "to cover expenses for creating conditions for large-scale information coverage of the socio-economic situation and development of modern information space in the territory of the Republic of Crimea, including the purchase of equipment".
In particular, the equipment and studio block, video walls, central equipment and video server are supposed to be rerouted for the money allocated.
It is also planned to acquire a mobile television station and a satellite transmitter.
In addition, from the allocated funds the company will pay for the use of fiber optic communication line (VOLS) and maintenance of the energy system.
Subsidies will be provided within the funds of the federal budget provided for the Ministry of Communications.
State broadcasting company "Crimea" was established in 1959, broadcasts in seven languages: Ukrainian, Russian, Crimean Tatar, German, Greek, Bulgarian and Armenian.
Today, the television signal coverage of the television and radio company is more than 75 percent of the peninsula territory.
In 2011 "Television Company "Crimea" received a license for television broadcasting in digital format.
